dilutus: <entryFree id="n13998" type="main" key="di_lu_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīlūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n13998.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a., diluted, thin, weak, soft</hi> (perh. only post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n13998.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">potio (opp. meraca),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: vinum dilutius pueris, sonibus meracius, id.; and: <cit><quote lang="la">potio quam dilutissima, id.: solum dilutius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> 17, 20, 33, § 144</bibl></cit>; hence also <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">dīlūtum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a liquid in which something has been dissolved, a solution</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 7, 28, § 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rubor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 22, 46, § 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amethystus dilutior,</quote> <trans><tr>paler</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 9, 40, § 122</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">colos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 5, 18, § 67</bibl></cit>: urina, Cels. <pb n="581" /> <cb n="DIMI" /> 2, 6: odor, <hi rend="ital">slight, faint</hi> (opp. acutus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 28, 33, § 110</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n13998.2" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of a wine-drinker, <hi rend="ital">drunk</hi> (opp. abstemius), Aus. Ep. a. Id. 11.—</sense><sense id="n13998.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (borrowed from colors), <hi rend="ital">clear, manifest</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dilutior erat defectus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 20, 3</bibl></cit>.—* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">dīlūtē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">slightly, weakly</hi>: Gallos post haec dilutius esse poturos, Cic. Font. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 12, 2</bibl>; acc. to others an adj., sc. vinum.</sense></entryFree>
diluvialis: <entryFree id="n13999" type="hapax" key="di_lu^vi^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīlŭvĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>diluvium</etym>, <sense id="n13999.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of a deluge</hi> or <hi rend="ital">flood</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">irruptio, i. e. diluvium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 9, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
diluvies: <entryFree id="n14000" type="main" key="di_lu^vi^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīlŭvĭes</orth>, <itype>ēi</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, also <orth extent="full" lang="la">dīlŭvĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">dīlŭvĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>diluo</etym>, lit., a washing away of the earth; hence, <sense id="n14000.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an inundation, flood, deluge</hi> (in all three forms only <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; yet in Seneca, Quaestt. Natt., diluvium stands for the general deluge; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>, <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign>). </sense><sense id="n14000.1" n="(a)" level="5"> Diluvies, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:255" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 255</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:292" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 292</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 29, 40</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 14, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 4, 3, § 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14000.2" n="(b)" level="5"> Diluvium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:205" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 205</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:434" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 434</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:27" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:29" default="NO">29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:2:3" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 2, 3</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:24:38 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 24, 38 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n14000.3" n="(g)" level="5"> Diluvio, <bibl default="NO"><author>Censor.</author> 18 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 46</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14000.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">diluvio ex illo tot vasta per aequora vecti,</quote> <trans><tr>desolation, destruction</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:228" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 228</bibl></cit> (ex illa vastitate, Serv.), <hi rend="ital">a deluge of invasion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:394" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 394</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
diluvio: <entryFree id="n14001" type="main" key="di_lu^vi^o1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīlŭvĭo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>diluvies</etym>, <sense id="n14001.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to inundate. to deluge</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:387" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 387</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n14002" type="main" key="di_lu^vi^o2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīlŭvĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. diluvies.</entryFree>
diluvium: <entryFree id="n14003" type="main" key="di_lu^vi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīlŭvĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. diluvies, <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign>.</entryFree>
dimachae: <entryFree id="n14004" type="greek" key="di^ma^chae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭmăchae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">dima/xai</foreign>, <sense id="n14004.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">soldiers who fought both on foot and on horseback</hi>, Anglice <hi rend="ital">dragoons;</hi> a sort of troops among the Macedonians, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:13:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 13, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dimachaerus: <entryFree id="n14005" type="gloss" key="di^ma^chaerus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭmăchaerus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">dima/xairos</foreign>, <sense id="n14005.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fighting with two swords</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladiator,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2584</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dimadesco: <entryFree id="n14006" type="hapax" key="di_ma^desco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dī-mădesco</orth>, <itype>dui, 3</itype>, <sense id="n14006.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch., to melt away</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nives,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:479" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 479</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dimano: <entryFree id="n14007" type="main" key="di_ma_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dī-māno</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">dem-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n14007.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to flow different ways, to spread abroad</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">meus hic forensis labor dimanavit ad existimationem hominum paulo latius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 3, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dimensio: <entryFree id="n14008" type="main" key="di_mensi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīmensĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>dimetior</etym>, <sense id="n14008.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a measuring</hi>. </sense><sense id="n14008.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">quadrati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:24:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 24, 57</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14008.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the axis of the earth</hi>, Hygin. Astr. 1, 3.—</sense><sense id="n14008.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Extent, dimensions</hi>, in gen., <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 6, 36</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 3 al.</bibl>—So <number>plur.</number> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 6, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14008.4" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:45" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">versuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 48</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 52</bibl> and 85.</sense></entryFree>
dimensus: <entryFree id="n14009" type="main" key="di_mensus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīmensus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from dimetior.</entryFree>
dimeter: <entryFree id="n14010" type="greek" key="di^me^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭmĕter</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-trus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">di/metros</foreign>, <sense id="n14010.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of two measures</hi> or <hi rend="ital">metres</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">versus,</quote> <trans><tr>a dimeter</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 506</bibl></cit> P.; <cit><quote lang="la">and simply dimetrus (sc. versus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1518,001:page=2437" default="NO"><author>Ter. Maur.</author> p. 2437</bibl></cit> ib.</sense></entryFree>
dimetior: <entryFree id="n14011" type="main" key="di_me_ti^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dī-mētĭor</orth>, <itype>mensus, 4</itype>, <sense id="n14011.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a., to measure</hi> any thing, <hi rend="ital">to measure out</hi> (v. demetior <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>—rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">studium dimetiendi caeli atque terrae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 14, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dimetiri et dinumerare syllabas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:43:147" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 43, 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">campum ad certamen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mundum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:11:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 11, 10</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:112" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 112</bibl>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">part.</hi> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">dīmētĭens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the diameter</hi> (<foreign lang="greek">dia/metros</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:86 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 23, 21, § 86 sq.</bibl>!*? In pass. signif.: <cit><quote lang="la">columnae altitudo dimetiatur in partes duodecim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8</bibl> prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">27: mirari se sollertiam ejus, a quo essent illa dimensa atque descripta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 17, 59</bibl></cit>; so in the <hi rend="ital">part.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:19:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 19, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 17, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:62:155" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 62, 155</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:231" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 231</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 284</bibl>.—Cf. in <hi rend="ital">fut. pass. part.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non cum vitae tempore esse dimetiendam commemorationem nominis nostri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:11:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 11, 29</bibl></cit> Halm (Baiter, dimittendam).</sense></entryFree>
dimeto: <entryFree id="n14012" type="main" key="di_me_to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dī-mēto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">dī-mētor</orth>, <itype>āri, 1</itype>, <sense id="n14012.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep., to measure out, mark out, to fix the limits of</hi> (rare; <cit><quote lang="la">perh. only in the foll. passages): locum castris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 38</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">dimetata signa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:43:110" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 43, 110</bibl></cit> (Baiter, demetata).—<hi rend="ital">Depon. form</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eorum enim cursus dimetati cognovimus, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 62, 155</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dimetria: <entryFree id="n14013" type="hapax" key="di^me_^tri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭmē^trĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">dimetri/a</foreign>, <sense id="n14013.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a poem consisting of iambic dimeters</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 16, 104</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dimicatio: <entryFree id="n14014" type="main" key="di_mi^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīmĭcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>dimico</etym>, <sense id="n14014.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fight, combat, furious encounter</hi> (cf.: pugna, proelium,<cb n="DIMI" />  certamen, contentio, acies; freq. and good prose). </sense><sense id="n14014.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:111:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 111, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:11" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:35" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 35</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 7, 7, § 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 2:1:11" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 2, 1, 11</bibl> et saep.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:86:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 86, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 1:11:12" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 1, 11, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14014.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">proelii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:section=5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, § 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">universae rei,</quote> <trans><tr>a pitched battle, general engagement</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 38</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which, universa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 32</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n14014.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> beyond the milit. sphere, <hi rend="ital">a combating, struggling; a contest</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non modo contentione, sed etiam dimicatione elaborandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">talis in remp. nostram labor, assiduitas, dimicatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:chapter=2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 7, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:4:4 al" default="NO">6, 4, 4 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n14014.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a perilous contest</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:chapter=32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 9, 23</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">capitis, famae, fortunarumque omnium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Perd. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortunae (c. c. discrimen),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:chapter=28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 28</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dimico: <entryFree id="n14015" type="main" key="di_mi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dī-mĭco</orth>, <itype>āvi</itype> (e. g. dimicavere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:85:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 85, 1</bibl>; <sense id="n14015.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">dimicaverant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 4, 3</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">dimicassent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:85:5 al" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 85, 5 al.</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">dimicuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 7, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 13, 28</bibl>), <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, lit., to brandish one's weapons against the enemy, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to fight, struggle, contend</hi> (freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n14015.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">manum conserere atque armis dimicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:20:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 20, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">armis cum aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferro pro patria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acie cum aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 49 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: in acie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:64:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 64, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proelio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 16, 2</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">6, 31, 1 al.: equitatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversus aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro legibus, pro libertate, pro patria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 19</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">tuto dimicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:24:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 24, 2</bibl></cit>; so <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 21, 5</bibl>; 3, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> et saep.—<hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ancipiti proelio dimicatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:63:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 63, 3</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">proelio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 41, 3</bibl></cit>; 3, 72, 3 al.; <cit><quote lang="la">and without proelio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 5, 16, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:85:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 85, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:12:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 12, 38</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in mortem dimicabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:85:4 al" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 85, 4 al.</bibl></cit>—In partic. of gladiatorial combats, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:26" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:18 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 7, 7, § 18 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n14015.2" n="b" level="4"> With an abstr. subject: <cit><quote lang="la">leonum feritas inter se non dimicat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:H. N. 7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> H. N. 7</bibl></cit> prooem. § 5.</sense><sense id="n14015.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> beyond the milit. sphere, <hi rend="ital">to struggle, to strive, to contend</hi>: omni ratione erit dimicandum, ut, etc., Cic. Div. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0013,001:22:72" default="NO"><author>Caecil.</author> 22, 72</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dimicantes competitores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de sua potentia periculo civitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 3</bibl></cit>; esp. with the accessory idea of risk, hazard: reos, de capite, de fama, de civitate, de fortunis, de liberis dimicantes (for which, shortly before: qui auderent se et salutem suam <hi rend="ital">in discrimen offerre</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:chapter=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 1</bibl>: de honore et gloria (for which, shortly before: de vita, de gloria <hi rend="ital">in discrimen vocantur</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:24:83" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 24, 83</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de vita gloriae causa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:10:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 10, 23</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">de vita,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 26</bibl>: de omnibus fortunis reip., Pompei. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 12</bibl> D.: <cit><quote lang="la">de fama,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,013:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Timoth. 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de liberis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 44 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">de repulsa,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>at the risk of one</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 40</bibl></cit>; cf. also without <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut in singulas horas capite dimices tuo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 12</bibl></cit> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:17:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 17, 56</bibl>, the reading is dubious, v. Madv. ad h. l.).—</sense><sense id="n14015.4" n="b" level="4"> In Tertullian, borrowed from the lang. of gladiators (v. supra, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> I.): <cit><quote lang="la">ad hanc jam lineam dimicabit nostra congressio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pudic. 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> adv. Marc. 1, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dimidiatio: <entryFree id="n14016" type="hapax" key="di_mi^di^a_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīmĭdĭātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>dimidio</etym>, <sense id="n14016.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a halving, dividing into halves</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">salutis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 1, 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dimidiatus: <entryFree id="n14017" type="main" key="di_mi^di^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīmĭdĭātus</orth>, <sense id="n14017.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P.</hi> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from dimidio.</sense></entryFree>
dimidietas: <entryFree id="n14018" type="main" key="di_mi^di^e^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīmĭdĭĕtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n14018.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a half</hi>, Pompei. Gr. 4, n. 8, p. 63.</sense></entryFree>
dimidio: <entryFree id="n14019" type="main" key="di_mi^di^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīmĭdĭo</orth>, no <sense id="n14019.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>dimidius</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to divide into two equal parts, to halve</hi> (as a finite verb, very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">quid dimidias Christum?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> de Carn. Chr. 5</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">viri dolosi non dimidiabunt dies suos,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>shall not live half the life of men</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:54:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 54, 23</bibl></cit>; cf. also, id. Job, 21, 21; but freq. and class. in the <hi rend="ital">perf. part.</hi> <orth extent="full" lang="la">dīmĭ-dĭātus</orth>, <hi rend="ital">halved, half</hi> (acc. to Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:14:19" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 14, 19</bibl>, applied to a whole, which is divided into halves; whereas dimidius is applied to a half; or, as Gellius rightly explains it, <hi rend="ital">dimidiatum</hi> nisi ipsum, quod divisum est, dici haud convenit; <hi rend="ital">dimidium</hi> vero est, non quod ipsum dimidiatum est, sed quae ex dimidiato pars altera est; cf. however, dimidius, I.): homines dimidiati, Cato ap. Gell. l. l.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:R. R. 151:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. R. 151, 3</bibl>; and comic.: procellunt sese in mensam dimidiati<cb n="DIMI" />  (<hi rend="ital">with half the body</hi>), dum appetunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 165</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also, transf.: dies quidem jam ad umbilicum est dimidiatus mortuus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 1, 2, 45</bibl></cit>: luna, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 39, 75, § 194</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">mensis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 16</bibl>: vas vini, Enn. ap. Gell. l. l.: porcus, Lucil. ib.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:34" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 34</bibl>: solea, Lucil. ap. Gell. l. l.: librum, fabulam legi, Varr. ib.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">exesis posterioribus partibus versiculorum, dimidiatis fere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:23:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 23, 66</bibl></cit>; so the comic verse respecting Terence: tu quoque, tu in summis, o dimidiate Menander, etc., Caes. ap. Suet. Vita Ter. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
dimidium: <entryFree id="n14020" type="main" key="di_mi^di^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīmĭdĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n14020.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the half</hi>, <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr> II.</sense></entryFree>
dimidius: <entryFree id="n14021" type="main" key="di_mi^di^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dī-mĭdĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>medius</etym>, <sense id="n14021.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">half</hi> (for the diff. between it and dimidiatus, v. dimidio). </sense><sense id="n14021.1" n="I" level="1"> As an adj., until the Aug. per. only in connection with pars, e. g.: <cit><quote lang="la">dimidiam partem nationum subegit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:3:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 3, 77</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:10:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 4, 10, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:618 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 618 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:720" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 720</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:40:103" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 40, 103</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:11:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 11, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:29:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 29, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:31:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 31, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 101</bibl> (twice); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 64:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 64, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:42" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 2:3:21" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 2, 3, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:122" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 122</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:2:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 1, 2, 44</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n14021.2" n="II" level="1"> Since the Aug. per., esp. in poets, also with other substantives, instead of dimidiatus (v. dimidio), <hi rend="ital">divided into two equal parts, halved</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mullus (opp. lupus totus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:37:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 37, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:95" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 15, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Memnone,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 15, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">forma circuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 59, 60, § 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clepsydrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 6, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labro basia dare,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>slightly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 10</bibl></cit> and 22; <cit><quote lang="la">so of busts: Priapus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:18" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 18</bibl></cit>; cf. Cicero's pun on the half-length likeness of his brother Quintus: frater meus dimidius major est quam totus, in <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 3</bibl> (the word dimidius, for dimidiatus, belongs prob. to Macr. himself).— </sense><sense id="n14021.3" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, so of persons of mixed descent: <cit><quote lang="la">dimidius patrum, dimidius plebis,</quote> <trans><tr>half patrician and half plebeian</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 2, 6</bibl></cit>. —Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> </sense><sense id="n14021.4" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">dīmidium</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the half</hi> (very freq. in all periods and kinds of writing): horae, Lucil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:14:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 14, 11</bibl>; so with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:1:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 5, 1, 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:2:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 5, 2, 67</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">71</bibl> et saep.; <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 87</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 68</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 2, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 1, 2, 17</bibl> et saep.; <case>abl.</case> dimidio, with comparatives: <cit><quote lang="la">dimidio minus opinor,</quote> <trans><tr>less by half</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 4, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 9, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 20, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 13, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:318" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 318</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n14021.5" n="2" level="3"> Like a <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi> with <hi rend="ital">quam</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vix dimidium militum quam quod acceperat successori tradidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:18:7" default="NO" valid="yes">45, 18, 7</bibl>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">dimidium facti, qui coepit, habet,</quote> <trans><tr>well begun is half done</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 40</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 81</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14021.6" n="B" level="2"> Rarely <orth extent="full" lang="la">dī-midia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. pars), <hi rend="ital">the half</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbenaca decocta in aqua ad dimidias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 12, 73, § 120</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
diminuo: <entryFree id="n14022" type="main" key="di_mi^nu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dī-mĭnŭo</orth> (or <orth extent="full" lang="la">dimmĭnuo</orth>), <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n14022.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to break into small pieces, to dash to pieces, to break</hi> (v. deminuo—rare; <cit><quote lang="la">perh. only ante-class.): qui ego illi speculo dimminuam caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 109</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">caput homini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 2, 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput tuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:7:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 7, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cerebrum tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 4, 2, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:614" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 614</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14022.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To violate, outrage, destroy by outrage</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">veritates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de verbis libri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:22:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Apoc. 22, 19</bibl></cit> (perh. deminuerit is a better reading).</sense></entryFree>
diminutio: <entryFree id="n14023" type="main" key="di_mi^nu_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīmĭnūtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, another reading for deminutio, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:F. 30" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> F. 30</bibl> in Maj. Auct. Class. v. 3, p. 13, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:11:12 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Rom. 11, 12 al.</bibl></entryFree>
dimissio: <entryFree id="n14024" type="main" key="di_missi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīmissĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>dimitto</etym>. <sense id="n14024.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A sending in different directions, a sending out, sending forth</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">dimissiones libertorum ad faenerandas provincias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:6:2:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 6, 2, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguinis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>blood-letting</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 8</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">in lemm</hi>.—* </sense><sense id="n14024.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A dismissing, discharging</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">propugnatorum atque remigum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:33:section=86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 33, § 86</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14024.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The remission</hi> (of pain, fever, etc.; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. accessio),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:3:13" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 3, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:2:18:108 al" default="NO">2, 18, 108 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
dimissor: <entryFree id="n14025" type="main" key="di_missor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīmissor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n14025.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a forgiver, pardoner</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">peccatorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 10 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
dimissoriaelitterae: <entryFree id="n14026" type="main" key="di_misso_riaelitterae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīmissōriaelitterae</orth> <itype>dicuntur</itype>, quae vulgo <sense id="n14026.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">apostoli</hi> dicuntur (<hi rend="ital">notice sent to a higher judge</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">dimissoriae autem dictae, quod causa ad eum, qui appellatus est, dimittitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:106" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 106</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:6:1" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 49, 6, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dimissus: <entryFree id="n14027" type="main" key="di_missus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīmissus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from dimitto.</entryFree>
dimitto: <entryFree id="n14028" type="main" key="di_mitto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dī-mitto</orth>, <itype>mīsi, missum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n14028.0" n="I" level="1"> With particular reference to the prep., <hi rend="ital">to send different ways, to send apart</hi>, i. e., </sense><sense id="n14028.1" n="A" level="2"> <pb n="582" /> <cb n="DIMI" /> <hi rend="ital">To send out</hi> or <hi rend="ital">forth</hi> in different directions, <hi rend="ital">to send about</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n14028.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Naevius pueros circum amicos dimittit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consules designatos circum provincias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:64" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litteras circum municipia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 22, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">litteras circa praefectos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litteras per omnes provincias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:79:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 79, 4</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">with which cf.: nuntios per agros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:31:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 6, 31, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">librum per totam Italiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">edicta per provincias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certos per litora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:577" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 577</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">nuntios tota civitate Aeduorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:38:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 38, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuntios in omnes partes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 19, 2</bibl></cit>; 4, 34, 5; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 5, 49, 8</bibl>; and <usg type="style">poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aciem (i. e. oculos) in omnes partes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:381" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 381</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praefectos in finitimas civitates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 7, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Manlium Faesulas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 27</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">nuntios ad Centrones, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:39:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 39, 1</bibl></cit>; so with <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 34, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 52 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> al.: <cit><quote lang="la">legatos quoquoversus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 3, 23, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 4, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:36:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 36, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dimissos equites pabulandi causa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 80, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">equitatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:71:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 7, 71, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnem ab se equitatum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> § 1.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum ignotas in artes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 188</bibl></cit>, <hi rend="ital">directs, applies</hi> (al. demittit).— </sense><sense id="n14028.3" n="(b)" level="5"> Without <hi rend="ital">object acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dimisit circum omnes propinquas regiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:112:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 112, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per provincias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 37</bibl></cit>: ad amicos, Cic. Tull. Fragm. § 22; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in omnes partis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:43:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 43, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14028.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To separate</hi> a multitude, <hi rend="ital">to break up, dissolve;</hi> and subjectively, <hi rend="ital">to dismiss</hi> (from one's self), <hi rend="ital">to discharge, disband</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatu dimisso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:3:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:12:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 12, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:32:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 32, 4</bibl> et saep.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">conventum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: exercitum (a standing military t. t.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:52:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 52, 4</bibl>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 9, 5</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">plures manus (with diducere, and opp. continere manipulos ad signa),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:34:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 34, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">delectum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:8:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 8, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">convivium,</quote> <trans><tr>to break up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 30</bibl> et saep.</sense><sense id="n14028.5" n="II" level="1"> With particular reference to the verb, <hi rend="ital">to send away</hi> either an individual or a body; <hi rend="ital">to let go, discharge, dismiss, release</hi>. </sense><sense id="n14028.6" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ab se et amandare in ultimas terras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:20:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 20, 57</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ab se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 63</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 4, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">discedentem aliquem non sine magno dolore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:ib. 12:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 18</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquos aequos placatosque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Or. 10:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Or. 10, 34</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem incolumem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:18:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 18, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 23, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex custodia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">e carcere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:1:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 21, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impunitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 51:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 51, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saucium ac fugatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neminem nisi victum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:ib. 3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 3</bibl></cit> et saep.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ludos pessumos, i. e. pessime ludificatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uxorem,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to put her away, repudiate her</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:63 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 63 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cossutia dimissa, quae desponsata fuerat, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sponsam intactam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 62</bibl></cit>: cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: aliquam e matrimonio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:49" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 49</bibl></cit>; v. also under <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> B.: <cit><quote lang="la">creditorem,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to pay him</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:31" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 31</bibl></cit>, '72: <cit><quote lang="la">debitorem,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to forgive him the debt</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:9:4" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 50, 9, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equos, in order to fight on foot,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 37 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:366" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 366</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">but also in order to flee,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 69 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostem ex manibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 64, 2</bibl></cit>; 3, 49, 2; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: Demosthenem (i. e. his orations) e manibus,</quote> <trans><tr>to put out of one's hands, to lay down</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:chapter=30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 30</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">istos sine ulla contumelia dimittamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:17:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 17, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites, in oppidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 21, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a turpissima suspicione,</quote> <trans><tr>to free, relieve</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 13, 4</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">dimittam, ut te velle video,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 106</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:86 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 86 al.</bibl> —</sense><sense id="n14028.7" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of inanimate objects: <cit><quote lang="la">eum locum, quem ceperant,</quote> <trans><tr>to abandon, desert</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:44:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 44, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Italiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 25, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ripas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 5, 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">complura oppida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:5" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">provinciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">captam Trojam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:226" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 226</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">fortunas morte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:6:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 6, 12</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">patrimonium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:chapter=26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 26 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">speratam praedam ex manibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signa ex metu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 69 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 66" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 66 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:367" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 367</bibl> et saep.— Esp.: dimissis manibus, <hi rend="ital">with hands relaxed</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">in all haste</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibi odos dimissis manibus in caelum volat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 52</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">dimissis pedibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> v. 54: <cit><quote lang="la">dimissis manibus fugere domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 3, 1, 16</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n14028.8" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to renounce, give up, abandon, forego, forsake</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ista philosophia, quae nunc prope dimissa revocatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2</bibl></cit>, <cb n="DINO" /> 4, 11: <cit><quote lang="la">rem saepius frustra tentatam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 26 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exploratam victoriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:52:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 7, 52, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppugnationem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 17, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:73:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 73, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">occasionem rei bene gerendae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:57:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 5, 57, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:72:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 72, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 25, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rei gerendae facultatem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 28, 2</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">3, 97, 1: omnem rei frumentariae spem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 73, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">condiciones pacis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 26, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">principatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:12:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 6, 12, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 21</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:21:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 21, 89</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">suum jus (opp. retinere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:13:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 13, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vim suam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 12</bibl></cit>: libertatem; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:chapter=34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 34 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:chapter=21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commemorationem nominis nostri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:chapter=11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeterita, instantia, futura pari oblivione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">matrimonia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:706" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 706</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coeptum iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:598" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 598</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cursus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:446" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 446</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">tantam fortunam ex manibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 37 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studium et iracundiam suam rei publicae dimittere, i. q. condonare,</quote> <trans><tr>to sacrifice to the good of the state</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:69:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 69, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tributa alicui,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to remit</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudibus nomen alicujus in longum aevum,</quote> <trans><tr>to transmit</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:448" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 448</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dimissum quod nescitur, non amittitur,</quote> <trans><tr>is foregone, not lost</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0622,001:138" default="NO"><author>Pub. Syr.</author> 138</bibl></cit> (Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
dimotus: <entryFree id="n14029" type="main" key="di_mo_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīmōtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from dimoveo.</entryFree>
dimoveo: <entryFree id="n14030" type="main" key="di_mo^ve^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dī-mŏvĕo</orth>, <itype>ōvi, ōtum</itype> (DISMOTUM, <sense id="n14030.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>), <itype>2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (in MSS. and edd. often confounded with demoveo, q. v.; not freq. before the Aug. per.; not in Caes. and Quint.; perh. not in Cic., where demovere appears everywhere to be the better reading). </sense><sense id="n14030.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To move asunder, to part, put asunder, separate, divide</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terram aratro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:513" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 513</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">glebas aratro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:341" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 341</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aera (c. c. dispellere umbras),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:839" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 839</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">auras,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 645</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cinerem foco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:642" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 642</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">undas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:891" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 891</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:708" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 708</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">aquas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:18:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 18, 80</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">19, 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rubum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:23:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 23, 7</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi sol radiis terram dimovit abortus (preceded by: ubi roriferis terram nox obruit umbris),</quote> <trans><tr>cleaves the earth, lays it open</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:869" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 869</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14030.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n14030.3" n="1" level="3"> Of a multitude of persons or things, <hi rend="ital">to separate from each other, to scatter, disperse, drive away, dismiss</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">humentem umbram polo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:589" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 589</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 7</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">gelidam umbram caelo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 210</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obstantes propinquos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:5:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 5, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turbam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:19" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 19</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">dimotis omnibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 49</bibl></cit>; cf.: VTEI EA BACANALIA SEI QVA SVNT ... DISMOTA SIENT, i. e. <hi rend="ital">be dissolved, abolished</hi>, S. C. de Bacchan. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n14030.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To separate</hi> from something, <hi rend="ital">to remove.</hi> </sense><sense id="n14030.5" n="a" level="4"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos (equites) spes societatis a plebe dimoverat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 42:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 42, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 7, 7, § 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dimovit perfregitque custodias Poena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:49" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parietes (al. demotis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plagulas (lecticae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:10 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 10 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n14030.6" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: gaudentem patrios findere sarculo Numquam dimoveas, ut, etc., <hi rend="ital">thou canst never entice away, in order to</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 1, 13</bibl> (al. demo-).—</sense><sense id="n14030.7" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To move to and fro, to put in motion</hi> (cf. dimitto, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> I.—so perh. only in Celsus): <cit><quote lang="la">superiores partes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:27:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 27, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se inambulatione levi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:24 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 24 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
dinaea: <entryFree id="n14031" type="main" key="Dinaea"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dinaea</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dinea</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n14031.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman female name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 7, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 33 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
dinarchus: <entryFree id="n14032" type="main" key="Di_narchus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dīnarchus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*dei/narxos</foreign>, <sense id="n14032.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an Attic orator, an imitator of Demosthenes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:23:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 23, 94</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:9:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 9, 36</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dindymus: <entryFree id="n14033" type="main" key="Dindy^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dindymus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-os</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dindy-mon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*di/ndumon</foreign>, <sense id="n14033.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mountain in Mysia near Pessinus, sacred to Cybele</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 32, 40, § 142</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl> (4), 22, 3; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:249" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 249</bibl>.—Also, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dindyma</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*di/nduma, ta/</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:618" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 618</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 252</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:223" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 223</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:234" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 234</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14033.1" n="II" level="1"> Hence, </sense><sense id="n14033.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dindymēnē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*dindumhnh/</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the goddess Cybele, who was worshipped there</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 16, 5</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dindymenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14033.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dindy-mārĭus</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a priest of Cybele</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Commod.</author> 17, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dine: <entryFree id="n14034" type="greek" key="di_ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīnē</orth>, <itype>es</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">di/nh</foreign>, <sense id="n14034.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a whirlwind</hi>: vertex ille est, vel uti dicitur <hi rend="ital">dine</hi>, etc., Ap. de Mundo, 12, p. 62, 32 (dub. Hild. Helicias).</sense></entryFree>
dingua: <entryFree id="n14035" type="main" key="dingua"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dingua</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. lingua.</entryFree>
dino: <entryFree id="n14036" type="main" key="Di_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dīno</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dīnōn</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*dei/nwn</foreign>, <sense id="n14036.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Greek historian of the time of Philip of</hi> <cb n="DIOD" /> <hi rend="ital">Macedonia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:23:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 23, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,009:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Con. 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 49, 70, § 136</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dinocrates: <entryFree id="n14037" type="main" key="Di_no_^cra^tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dīnō^crătes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*deinokra/ths</foreign>, <sense id="n14037.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Grecian architect in the time of Alexander the Great</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2</bibl>, praef. 1 sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 4</bibl> <hi rend="ital">extr.</hi> 1.</sense></entryFree>
dinomache: <entryFree id="n14038" type="main" key="Di_no^ma^che_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dīnŏmăchē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*deinoma/xh</foreign>, <sense id="n14038.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the mother of Alcibiades;</hi> hence, <usg type="style">poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dinomaches ego sum—as much as to say,</quote> <trans><tr>I am a person of quality</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:4:20" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 4, 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dinomachus: <entryFree id="n14039" type="main" key="Di_no^ma^chus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dīnŏmăchus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*deino/maxos</foreign>, <sense id="n14039.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Greek philosopher</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:8:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 8, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:33:119" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 33, 119</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dinosco: <entryFree id="n14040" type="main" key="di_nosco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dī-nosco</orth> (old form, <orth extent="full" lang="la">dīgnosco</orth>—no <sense id="n14040.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> nor <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>), <itype>ĕre, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>dis, 2.; nosco</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to know apart, to distinguish, discern</hi> one thing from another (perh. not ante-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n14040.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vix ut dinosci possit a mastiche verā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 17, 36, § 72</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n14040.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">civem dinoscere hoste,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 15, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut possem curvo dinoscere rectum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aera tinnitu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocem auribus, speciem oculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:ib. 18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid sapore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:2:20" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 2, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14040.3" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">accus.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">suos et alienos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:5:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vera bona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:2" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veri speciem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:105" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 105</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14040.4" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">rel. clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dinoscere Quid solidum crepet, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:24" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 24</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter se similes, vix ut dinoscere possis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:835" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 835</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dinumerabilis: <entryFree id="n14041" type="main" key="di_nu^me^ra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīnŭmĕrābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>dinumero</etym>, <sense id="n14041.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be numbered, calculable</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> in Psa. 150 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
dinumeratio: <entryFree id="n14042" type="main" key="di_nu^me^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīnŭmĕrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n14042.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a counting over, reckoning up, enumeration</hi>. </sense><sense id="n14042.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">noctium ac dierum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">(dierum),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 5, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(personarum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:10:10:section=16" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 10, 10, § 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,016:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Par. 2, 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14042.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp., as a figure of speech, i. q. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)pari/qmhsis</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:54:207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 54, 207</bibl>; quoted ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:35" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 1, 35</bibl> (who, however, does not regard it as a figure); 9, 3, 91 Spald.</sense></entryFree>
dinumerator: <entryFree id="n14043" type="main" key="di_nu^me^ra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīnŭmĕrātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n14043.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a reckoner, calculator</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">syllabarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:in Psa. 55:10" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> in Psa. 55, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dinumero: <entryFree id="n14044" type="main" key="di_nu^me^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dī-nŭmĕro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n14044.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to count over, reckon up, enumerate</hi>. </sense><sense id="n14044.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">stellas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:43:154" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 43, 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 15</bibl></cit>;
