cf. <cit><quote lang="la">horas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 73, 75, § 185</bibl></cit>: tempora, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:691" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 691</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">noctes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:574 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 574 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">syllabas (c. c. dimetiri),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:43:147" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 43, 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spoliata templa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 11, 18, § 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">generis gradus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:622" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 622</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">centuriat Capuae, dinumerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n14044.2" n="II" level="1"> In Plaut. and Ter. in partic., mercantile t. t., <hi rend="ital">to count out, pay out</hi> money: <cit><quote lang="la">argentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 68</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 1, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hibus stipendium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:1:1:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 1, 1, 74</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">viginti minas illi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 7, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dinummium: <entryFree id="n14045" type="greek" key="di^nummi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭ-nummĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>vox hibr., from <foreign lang="greek">di/s</foreign> and nummus</etym>, <sense id="n14045.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tax of two</hi> nummi, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Theod.</author> 14, 27, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dinuptila: <entryFree id="n14046" type="main" key="di^nupti^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭnuptĭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n14046.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi> = bryonia, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 66</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dio: <entryFree id="n14047" type="main" key="di^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭo</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-ōn</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*di/wn</foreign>. <sense id="n14047.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A brother-in-law of the elder Dionysius, of Syracuse, the pupil and friend of Plato</hi>. His life was written by Nepos and Plutarch; cf. also Cic Tusc. 5, 35; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 34</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Jornand.</author> 2, 92</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14047.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An Academic philosopher</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 4, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14047.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Stoic philosopher</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> dub. (al. Diogenes).—</sense><sense id="n14047.3" n="IV" level="1"> Dio Halaesinus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:10 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 10 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
diobolaris: <entryFree id="n14048" type="greek" key="di^o_bo^la_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭōbŏlāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vox hibr., <foreign lang="greek">diw/bolon</foreign>, with ending -aris</etym>, <sense id="n14048.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that costs</hi> or <hi rend="ital">is worth two</hi> oboli: <cit><quote lang="la">scorta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 58</bibl></cit>; cf. id. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=64" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 64</bibl>; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=74:6" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 74, 6</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">anus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:2:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 2, 64</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭōbŏlārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the title of a comedy</hi> otherwise unknown, <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> 566, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
diochares: <entryFree id="n14049" type="main" key="Di^o^cha^res"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dĭŏchăres</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n14049.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a freedman of Caesar</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 11, 6, 7</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dĭŏchă-rīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of Diochares</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 45, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
diocletianus: <entryFree id="n14050" type="main" key="Di^ocle_ti^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dĭoclētĭānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, C. Aurelius Valerius, <sense id="n14050.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman emperor from</hi> 284-305 A. D., Aurel. Vict. <bibl default="NO"><author>Caes.</author> 38</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epit. 39</bibl>; Eutrop. 9, 13 sq.; <cit><quote lang="la">before his accession to the throne named Diocles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 39" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Ep. 39</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
diodorus: <entryFree id="n14051" type="main" key="Di^o^do_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dĭŏdōrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*dio/dwros</foreign>. <sense id="n14051.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Peripatetic philosopher, a pupil of Critolaüs</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:chapter=5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5</bibl>, <pb n="583" /> <cb n="DION" /> 30 sq.—</sense><sense id="n14051.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A famous dialectician</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:chapter=6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 53, 54, § 180</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14051.2" n="III" level="1"> Siculus, <hi rend="ital">a well-known historian of the time of Augustus</hi>. His work, entitled <foreign lang="greek">*biblioqh/kh</foreign>, of which a portion is still extant, is mentioned by Plin. H. N. praef. § 25; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 13, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
diodotus: <entryFree id="n14052" type="main" key="Di^o^do^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dĭŏdŏtus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*dio/dotos</foreign>, <sense id="n14052.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Stoic, and teacher of Cicero</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=90" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 90</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 39</bibl> et saep.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dioecesis: <entryFree id="n14053" type="greek" key="di^oece_sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭœcēsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">dioi/khsis</foreign>. <sense id="n14053.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A governor's jurisdiction, a district</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 8, 4</bibl> (<bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 13, 53</bibl> and 67, written as Greek); <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Theod.</author> 7, 6, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 17, 7, 6</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n14053.1" n="II" level="1"> In eccl. Lat., <hi rend="ital">a bishop's jurisdiction, a diocese</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 7, 6 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; sometimes also <hi rend="ital">a parish</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dioecetes: <entryFree id="n14054" type="greek" key="di^oece_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭœcētes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">dioikhth/s</foreign>, <sense id="n14054.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an overseer of the revenue, royal treasurer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 8, 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
diogenes: <entryFree id="n14055" type="main" key="Di^o^ge^nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dĭŏgĕnes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*dioge/nhs</foreign>. <sense id="n14055.0" n="I" level="1"> Apolloniates, <hi rend="ital">a celebrated Ionian philosopher, pupil of Anaximenes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:12:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 12, 29</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14055.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The well-known Cynic philosopher of Sinope</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:43:104" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 43, 104</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:chapter=36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 36</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n14055.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Stoic, teacher of Carneades and Laelius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:3:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 7</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n14055.3" n="IV" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A friend of M. Caelius Rufus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 12, 2</bibl>; id. Cael. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 8, 8, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
diogmitae: <entryFree id="n14056" type="greek" key="di^o_gmi_tae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭōgmītae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*d*i*w*g*m*i*t*a*i</foreign> [from <foreign lang="greek">diwgmo/s</foreign>, pursuit], <sense id="n14056.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sort of lightarmed frontier troops kept for the pursuit of robbers</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 27, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Anton. Philos. 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
diomedes: <entryFree id="n14057" type="main" key="Di^o^me_des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dĭŏmēdes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*diomh/dhs</foreign>. <sense id="n14057.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A son of Tydeus, king of Aetolia, and Deipyle, the successor of Adrastus in Argos;</hi> a famous hero at the siege of Troy, after which he went to Apulia, where he founded Argyripa (<hi rend="ital">Arpi</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:100 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 100 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 457</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:752" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 752</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 92</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 146</bibl> et saep.—As grandson of Oeneus called Oenides, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:512" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 512</bibl>: Diomedis Campus, <hi rend="ital">the region about</hi> Cannae <hi rend="ital">in Apulia, on the Aufidus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 10</bibl>; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=75" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 75</bibl> Müll.—Deriv., <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dĭŏmēdēus (-īus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of Diomedes</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">enses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:806" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 806</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">furtum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the rape of the Trojan Palladium</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Silv. 5, 3, 179</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">called also, ausa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> VI. Cons. Honor. 479</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agri,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Aetolian</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:93" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 93</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">on the contrary, arces,</quote> <trans><tr>the cities founded by Diomedes in Italy</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Silv. 3, 3, 163</bibl></cit>.—So too Diomedea (insula), <hi rend="ital">an island</hi> or <hi rend="ital">group of islands in the Adriatic, on the coast of Apulia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">St. Domenico, St. Nicola</hi>, and <hi rend="ital">Caprara</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:13" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 26, 30, § 151</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Diomedis insula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 12, 1, 3, § 6</bibl></cit>; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=75" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 75</bibl> Müll.—Hence, the birds of that place (acc. to the fable of the metamorphosed companions of Diomedes) are called Diomedeae aves, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 44, 61, § 126</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 11, 271</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 12, 7, 28</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14057.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A king of the Bistones in Thrace, who gave his captives to be eaten by his horses; overcome at last by Hercules</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 8, 300</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 752</bibl>.—Hence, Diomedei equi, <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 2 praef.</bibl> 12; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 19, 9</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Rufin. 1, 254</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dion: <entryFree id="n14058" type="main" key="Di^o_n"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dĭōn</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, v. Dio.</entryFree>
dione: <entryFree id="n14059" type="main" key="Di^o_ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dĭōnē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">-a</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:23:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 23, 59</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*diw/nh</foreign>. <sense id="n14059.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The mother of Venus</hi>, Cic. l. l.; Hyg. praef.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 3, 433</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dĭōnæus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of Dione</hi>: vestis, <hi rend="ital">the garment worked by Dione for her daughter</hi>, Claud. Epith. Pall. et Cel. 102.—Far more freq. as in Greek, </sense><sense id="n14059.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Venus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:461" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 461</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 309</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:14:33 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 14, 33 al.</bibl>—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dĭōnæus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of Dione (Venus)</hi>: mater, <hi rend="ital">Venus</hi> herself (with reference to Aeneas), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 19</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, Dionaeus Caesar, as the descendant of Iulus, Aeneas, and consequently of Venus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:9:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 9, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">columba,</quote> <trans><tr>sacred to Venus</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Silv. 3, 5, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:286" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 286</bibl></cit>: antrum, <hi rend="ital">Dione's grotto</hi>, as the scene of love and love-songs, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 1, 39</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dionymus: <entryFree id="n14060" type="main" key="di^o_ny^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭōnymus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">diw/numos</foreign>, <sense id="n14060.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">with a double name</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 580</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
dionysia: <entryFree id="n14061" type="main" key="Di^o^ny_sia1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dĭŏnȳsia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n14061.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a noted dancer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:chapter=8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n14062" type="main" key="Di^o^ny_si^a2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dĭŏnȳsĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, v. Dionysus.</entryFree>
dionysiacus: <entryFree id="n14063" type="main" key="Di^o^ny_si^a^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dĭŏnȳsĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Dionysus, II. C. <cb n="DIPH" /></entryFree>
dionysias: <entryFree id="n14064" type="main" key="Di^o^ny_si^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dĭŏnȳsĭas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, v. Dionysus, <sense id="n14064.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">no.</hi> II. B.</sense></entryFree>
dionysius: <entryFree id="n14065" type="main" key="Di^o^ny_si^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dĭŏnȳsĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*dionu/sios</foreign>, <sense id="n14065.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of several celebrated Greeks;</hi> esp., </sense><sense id="n14065.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The elder Dionysius, tyrant of Syracuse</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dio, 1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dio, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,021:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Reg. 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:20 sq" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 20 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:33 sq" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 33 sq.</bibl> al.—</sense><sense id="n14065.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">His son, likewise tyrant of Syracuse</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dio, 3 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dio, 3 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:1 sq" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 21, 1 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:9:6" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 9, 6</bibl> <hi rend="ital">extr.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n14065.3" n="III" level="1"> Heracleotes, <hi rend="ital">a pupil of Zeno of Citium, at first a Stoic, afterwards a Cyrenaic</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 22 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n14065.4" n="IV" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Stoic, contemporary with Cicero</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14065.5" n="V" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A musician of Thebes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 2, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14065.6" n="VI" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Name of a slave</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 38</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14065.7" n="VII" level="1"> Dionysius Cato, <hi rend="ital">author of the</hi> Disticha de moribus ad filium, v. Teuffel, Roem. <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> § 34, 2.</sense></entryFree>
dionysonymphas: <entryFree id="n14066" type="main" key="di^o^ny_so^nymphas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭŏnȳsŏnymphas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">dionusonumfa/s</foreign>, <sense id="n14066.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, i. q. casignete, q. v., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 17, 102, § 165</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dionysopolitae: <entryFree id="n14067" type="main" key="Di^o^ny_so^po^li_tae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dĭŏnȳsŏpŏlītae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n14067.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Dionysopolis, a city of Magna Phrygia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:2:2:section=4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 2, 2, § 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 29, 29, § 106</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 10, 17, § 44</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dionysus: <entryFree id="n14068" type="main" key="Di^o^ny_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dĭŏnȳsus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-os</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*dio/nusos</foreign>, <sense id="n14068.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Greek name of Bacchus</hi> (not in the Aug. poets), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">23</bibl>; Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 2, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epigr. 30</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14068.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv., </sense><sense id="n14068.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dĭŏnȳsĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Bacchus;</hi> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dĭŏ-nȳsia</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*dionu/sia, ta/</foreign> (sc. <foreign lang="greek">i(era/</foreign>), <hi rend="ital">the festival of Bacchus</hi>, in Greece celebrated every three years (Lat. Bacchanalia), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:5:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 5, 2, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 91</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 110</bibl> Don.; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 4, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14068.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dĭŏnȳsĭas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a precious stone, of a black color</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 57, § 157</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14068.4" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dĭŏnȳsĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">relating to Bacchus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludi, i. q. Liberalia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ecl. de Feriis Rom. 29</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
diopetes: <entryFree id="n14069" type="greek" key="di^o^pe^tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭŏpĕtes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">diopeth/s</foreign> (falling from heaven): rana, <sense id="n14069.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sort of frog, rainfrog</hi>, called also, calamites, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 7, 24, § 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:139" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 10, 50, § 139</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
diophanes: <entryFree id="n14070" type="main" key="Di^o^pha^nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dĭŏphănes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*diofa/nhs</foreign>. <sense id="n14070.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of Mitylenae, teacher of Tib. Gracchus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:27:104" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 27, 104</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14070.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of Nicaea, a Latin author on husbandry</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:1:8 al" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 1, 8 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
dioptra: <entryFree id="n14071" type="greek" key="di^optra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭoptra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">di/optra</foreign>, <sense id="n14071.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an optical instrument</hi> to measure the height of places, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 6</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">for measuring the sun's shadow,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 69, 69, § 176</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dioryctos: <entryFree id="n14072" type="greek" key="Di^o_ryctos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dĭōryctos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">diwrukto/s</foreign> [<foreign lang="greek">diw=ruc</foreign>], <sense id="n14072.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a trench</hi> or <hi rend="ital">canal, in Acarnania, between Leucadia and the continent</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 1, 2, § 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dioryx: <entryFree id="n14073" type="greek" key="di^o_ryx"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭōryx</orth>, <itype>ygis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">diw=ruc</foreign>, <sense id="n14073.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a canal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">manu factus amnis, ex Nili alveo dioryge adductus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:8" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
dios: <entryFree id="n14074" type="greek" key="Di^os1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dĭos bălănus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*dio\s ba/lanos</foreign>, <sense id="n14074.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of chestnut</hi>, perh. <hi rend="ital">the large sweet chestnut</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 23, 25, § 93</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n14075" type="greek" key="Di^os2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dĭos pneuma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*dio\s pneu=ma</foreign>, <sense id="n14075.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a species of rosemary</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 79</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
diospyros: <entryFree id="n14076" type="greek" key="Di^ospy^ros"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dĭospyros</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*dio/spuros</foreign>, <sense id="n14076.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, otherwise called lithospermon, <hi rend="ital">stonecrop</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 11, 74, § 98</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
diota: <entryFree id="n14077" type="greek" key="di^o_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭōta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">diw/th</foreign>, <sense id="n14077.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a two-handled vessel, a wine-jar</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:9:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 9, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
diovis: <entryFree id="n14078" type="main" key="Di^o^vis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dĭŏvis</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dĭjŏvis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>collat. form of Jovis, old nom. for later Juppiter, q. v.; cf. Diespiter</etym>, <sense id="n14078.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the old Italian name for Juppiter</hi>, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=66" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 66</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:12:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 12, 1</bibl> and 6; Inscr. in Bullet. del <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 1846</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
diox: <entryFree id="n14079" type="gloss" key="diox"><orth extent="full" lang="la">diox</orth>, <itype>genus piscis frequens in Ponto</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:75:3" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> 75, 3</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
diphilus: <entryFree id="n14080" type="main" key="Di_phi^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dīphĭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*di/filos</foreign>. <sense id="n14080.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A celebrated Greek comic writer of Sinope, imitated by Plautus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:prol. 32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. prol. 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:prol. 32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. prol. 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:prol. 6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. prol. 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:16:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 16, 3</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n14080.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An architect employed by Quintus Cicero</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14080.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Secretary of Crassus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:30:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 30, 136</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
diphryges: <entryFree id="n14081" type="greek" key="diphry^ges"><orth extent="full" lang="la">diphryges</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">difruge/s, to/</foreign>, <sense id="n14081.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of slag formed in furnaces when copper is melted</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 13, 37, § 135</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:7:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 7, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 227" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 227</bibl> and 247.</sense></entryFree>
diphthongus: <entryFree id="n14082" type="greek" key="diphthongus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">diphthongus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">di/fqoggos</foreign>, <sense id="n14082.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a diphthong</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 3, § 277</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 561</bibl> P. al.</sense></entryFree>
diphyes: <entryFree id="n14083" type="greek" key="di^phy^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭphyes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">difuh/s</foreign>, <sense id="n14083.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious</hi> <cb n="DIRE" /> <hi rend="ital">stone, otherwise unknown</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 57, § 157</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
diplangium: <entryFree id="n14084" type="main" key="di_^plangi_um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dī^plangīum</orth>, <itype>īi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">diplaggei=on</foreign>, <sense id="n14084.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a double vessel</hi> (pure Lat. duplex vas), <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 1, 19</bibl> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 73" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 73</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
diplasius: <entryFree id="n14085" type="greek" key="di_^pla^si^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dī^plăsĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">dipla/sios</foreign>, <sense id="n14085.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">twofold, duplicate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex ratione diplasia, hoc est duplici,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 934</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
diplinthius: <entryFree id="n14086" type="greek" key="diplinthi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">diplinthĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">dipli/nqios</foreign>, <sense id="n14086.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">two bricks thick</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">parietes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:8:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 8, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
diplois: <entryFree id="n14087" type="greek" key="di_^plo^is"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dī^plŏïs</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">diploi+/s</foreign>, <sense id="n14087.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a double robe to be wrapped around the body, a cloak, mantle</hi>, Sulpic. Sever. Hist. Sacr. 1, 35, 7; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:108:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 108, 28</bibl>; id. Baruch, 5, 2; Acro on <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 25</bibl>; Nov. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 316, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
diploma: <entryFree id="n14088" type="greek" key="di_^plo_ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dī^plōma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype> (<case>dat.</case> and <sense id="n14088.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abl. plur.</hi> regul. diplomatibus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 122</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:50" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 50</bibl>; Murat. Inscr. 885, 4), <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">di/plwma</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a letter folded double</hi>, viz., </sense><sense id="n14088.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A state letter of recommendation</hi> given to persons travelling to the provinces, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 12, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:17:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 10, 17, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:chapter=37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:14 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 14 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n14088.2" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a document drawn up by a magistrate</hi>, assuring to the holder some favor or privilege, <hi rend="ital">a diploma</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:50" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 1:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 1, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:10:27 al" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 10, 27 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
diplomarius: <entryFree id="n14089" type="gloss" key="diplo_ma_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">diplōmārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>diploma</etym>, <sense id="n14089.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who carried out the imperial letters of recommendation</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2917</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dipondium: <entryFree id="n14090" type="main" key="di^pondi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭpondĭum</orth> = dupondium, q. v., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:12:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 12, 6</bibl>.</entryFree>
dipsacos: <entryFree id="n14091" type="greek" key="dipsa^cos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dipsăcos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">di/yakos</foreign>, <sense id="n14091.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the plant teasel</hi>, Dipsacus fullonum, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 9, 47, § 71</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dipsas: <entryFree id="n14092" type="greek" key="dipsas1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dipsas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">diya/s</foreign>, <sense id="n14092.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of serpent whose bite causes violent thirst</hi>, the Coluber Vipera, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 8, 80, § 152</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:44:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 44, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:610" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 610</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:718" default="NO" valid="yes">718</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:313" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 313</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:8:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Deut. 8, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n14093" type="main" key="Dipsas2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dipsas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n14093.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a name given to an old bawd</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 8, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dipteros: <entryFree id="n14094" type="greek" key="dipte^ros"><orth extent="full" lang="la">diptĕros</orth>, <itype>on</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">di/pteros</foreign>, <sense id="n14094.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">with two wings</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:1:7 praef" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 1, 7 praef.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
diptota: <entryFree id="n14095" type="greek" key="dipto_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">diptōta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">di/ptwta</foreign>. In the later gramm., <sense id="n14095.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nouns that have only two cases, diptotes</hi>, Diomed. p. 288 P. et saep.; cf.: diptotos forma, Ars <bibl default="NO"><author>Consent.</author> p. 2033 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> ib.</sense></entryFree>
diptycha: <entryFree id="n14096" type="greek" key="dipty^cha"><orth extent="full" lang="la">diptycha</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">di/ptuxa</foreign>. <sense id="n14096.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A writing-tablet of two leaves</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Theod.</author> 15, 9, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 2:80 al" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 2, 80 al.</bibl>— </sense><sense id="n14096.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The double shell</hi> of the oyster, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Hexaem. 5, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dipylon: <entryFree id="n14097" type="main" key="Di^py^lon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dĭpylon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*di/pulon</foreign>, <sense id="n14097.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a gate at Athens that closed the Ceramicus, and through which one passed in going to the Academy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:24:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 24, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dipyros: <entryFree id="n14098" type="greek" key="di^py^ros"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭpyros</orth>, <itype>on</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">di/puros</foreign>, <sense id="n14098.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">twice burned</hi>, Phaëthon, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:47:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 47, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dirado: <entryFree id="n14099" type="hapax" key="di_ra_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dī-rādo</orth>, <itype>rāsi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n14099.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to scratch slightly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tergum piscis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Varr. 11, 40</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dirae: <entryFree id="n14100" type="main" key="Di_rae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dīrae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n14100.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Furies</hi>, v. dirus, I. B. 2.</sense></entryFree>
dirca: <entryFree id="n14101" type="main" key="Dirca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dirca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. Dirce <sense id="n14101.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
dirce: <entryFree id="n14102" type="main" key="Dirce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dircē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype> (<case>acc.</case> Dircam, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 65</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*di/rkh</foreign>. <sense id="n14102.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A fountain N. W. of Thebes, in Boeotia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 7, 12, § 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:239" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 239</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:38" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 38</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14102.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the region lying around this fountain</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:322" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 322</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dircæus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Dircean;</hi> hence (pars pro toto), <hi rend="ital">Boeotian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Thebae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:17:33" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 17, 33</bibl></cit> (4, 16, 33 M.); cf. <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,003:1:12" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Ach. 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arva,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil. 1, 320</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Amphion,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cygnus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Pindar</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 2, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">heros,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Polynices</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:142" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 142</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n14102.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The wife of the Theban prince Lycus</hi>, who, on account of her cruelty to Antiope, was tied to a bull by Amphion and Zetheus, and dragged about till dead, and was afterwards thrown (changed, acc. to the fable) into the above-named fountain, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:15:13" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 15, 13</bibl> (4, 14, 11 M.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 7" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 7</bibl> and 8; Plaut. l. l.</sense></entryFree>
dircenna: <entryFree id="n14103" type="main" key="Dircenna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dircenna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n14103.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fountain in Spain, near Bilbilis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:50:17" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 50, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dircion: <entryFree id="n14104" type="main" key="dirci^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dircĭon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n14104.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant also known as</hi> Apollinaris herba, <hi rend="ital">a kind of solanum</hi>, Ap. Herb. 23.</sense></entryFree>
directa: <entryFree id="n14105" type="main" key="di_recta_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīrectā</orth> (sc. viā), <sense id="n14105.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perpendicularly</hi>, see dirigo, <hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi> c.</sense></entryFree>
directarius: <entryFree id="n14106" type="main" key="di_recta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīrectārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>dirigo</etym>, <sense id="n14106.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who</hi> <pb n="584" /> <cb n="DIRI" /> <hi rend="ital">secretly enters a house in order to steal, a sneak-thief, burglar</hi> (very rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:11:7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 11, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 5, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
directe: <entryFree id="n14107" type="main" key="di_recte_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīrectē</orth>, <sense id="n14107.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adv., directly, straight</hi>, etc., v. dirigo, <hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi> a.</sense></entryFree>
directiangulus: <entryFree id="n14108" type="hapax" key="di_recti^angu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīrectĭangŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>directus-angulus</etym>, <sense id="n14108.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">right-angled, rectangular</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 712</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
directilineus: <entryFree id="n14109" type="hapax" key="di_recti^li_ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīrectĭlīnĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>directus-linea</etym>, <sense id="n14109.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rectilinear</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 711</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
directim: <entryFree id="n14110" type="main" key="di_rectim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīrectim</orth>, <sense id="n14110.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adv., directly, straightway</hi>, etc., v. dirigo, <hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi> d.</sense></entryFree>
directio: <entryFree id="n14111" type="main" key="di_recti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīrectĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>dirigo</etym> (a very rare word). <sense id="n14111.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A making straight</hi> or <hi rend="ital">even, a levelling</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">plana coagmentorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:3:5 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 3, 5 sq.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n14111.1" n="B" level="2"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">a straight line</hi>, App. de Mundo, p. 57.—</sense><sense id="n14111.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n14111.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A directing, aiming</hi>, towards any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam rationis ad veritatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:30" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 30</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14111.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Righteousness, uprightness</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:44:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 44, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">118, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
directitude: <entryFree id="n14112" type="main" key="di_recti^tu_de"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīrectĭtūde</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>directus</etym>, <sense id="n14112.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rightness, correctness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aeterna,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> in Psa. 101, 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
directo: <entryFree id="n14113" type="main" key="di_recto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīrecto</orth>, <sense id="n14113.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adv., directly, in a straight line</hi>, v. dirigo, <hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi> b.</sense></entryFree>
directorius: <entryFree id="n14114" type="hapax" key="di_recto_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīrectōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>dirigo</etym>, <sense id="n14114.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that directs</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sends in any direction, directory</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Theod.</author> 14, 15, 3, § 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
directura: <entryFree id="n14115" type="hapax" key="di_rectu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīrectūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n14115.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a making straight, even, a levelling</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 3, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
directus: <entryFree id="n14116" type="main" key="di_rectus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīrectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from dirigo.</entryFree>
diremptio: <entryFree id="n14117" type="hapax" key="di^rempti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭremptĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>dirimo</etym>, <sense id="n14117.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a separation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:7:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 7, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
diremptus: <entryFree id="n14118" type="main" key="di^remptus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭremptus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from dirimo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n14119" type="hapax" key="di^remptus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭremptus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>dirimo</etym>, <sense id="n14119.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a separation</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:29:71" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 29, 71</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
direptio: <entryFree id="n14120" type="main" key="di_repti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīreptĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>diripio</etym>, <sense id="n14120.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plundering, pillaging</hi> (rare, but good prose): <cit><quote lang="la">urbs relicta direptioni et incendiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">urbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 52</bibl></cit>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppidi (with expugnatio),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">profanorum sacrorumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:69" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sociorum (with vexatio),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 7, 18</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 13, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n14120.1" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The stealing, rape</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurei velleris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 8, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
direptor: <entryFree id="n14121" type="main" key="di_reptor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīreptor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n14121.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plunderer</hi> (very rare; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fur, praedo, raptor),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:11:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 11, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
direptus: <entryFree id="n14122" type="main" key="di_reptus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīreptus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from diripio.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n14123" type="hapax" key="di_reptus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīreptus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>diripio</etym>, <sense id="n14123.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plundering</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Sever. 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
diribeo: <entryFree id="n14124" type="main" key="di^ri^be^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭrĭbĕo</orth>, no <sense id="n14124.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ĭtum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>dishabeo, like dirimo, from dis-emo, to keep apart, hence</etym>, pub. law t. t., <hi rend="ital">to lay apart, separate, divide, sort</hi>, the tablets or ballots taken out of the ballot-box, in order to determine who has the majority: <cit><quote lang="la">dum de te quinque et septuaginta tabellae diribeantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:40:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 40, 96</bibl></cit> Halm: <cit><quote lang="la">tabellas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 4, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:20:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 20, 49</bibl> Kayser, cf. Wund. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">suffragia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:2:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:12:7" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 12, 7</bibl></cit>; also <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:5:18" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 5, 18</bibl> (al. dirimere).—* </sense><sense id="n14124.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to distribute</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui gentes, regna diribet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 15, 24, § 118</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
diribitio: <entryFree id="n14125" type="main" key="di^ri^bi^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭrĭbĭtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>diribeo</etym>, <sense id="n14125.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a separating</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sorting of the tablets taken from the ballot-box</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 6, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Laud. in Patr. 3, p. 40" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Laud. in Patr. 3, p. 40</bibl> ed. Mai.</sense></entryFree>
diribitor: <entryFree id="n14126" type="main" key="di^ri^bi^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭrĭbĭtor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n14126.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the separater</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sorter of the ballots used in voting</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:15:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 15, 36</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> post Red. in Sen. 11, 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Grat. Act. 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14126.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">a distributor</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, 32, p. 137</bibl> ed. Oud.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 18, 5, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
diribitorium: <entryFree id="n14127" type="main" key="di^ri^bi^to_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭrĭbĭtōrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. aedificium; in Dio Cass. 55, 8: <foreign lang="greek">to\ deiribitw/rion</foreign>) [id.], <sense id="n14127.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the building in which the ballots were sorted</hi> (v. diribeo), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:18" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:201" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 40, 76, § 201</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:102" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 15, 24, § 102</bibl> Sillig. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi></sense></entryFree>
dirigo: <entryFree id="n14128" type="main" key="di_ri^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dī-rĭgo</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">dērĭgo</orth> (the latter form preferred by Roby, L. G. 2, p. 387; cf. R<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:Proleg. ad Verg. p. 401 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Proleg. ad Verg. p. 401 sq.</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 19, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:47:8" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 47, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:28" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 28</bibl> Weissenb.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:47:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 47, 2</bibl> Drak.; Lach. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:609" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 609</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 40</bibl> Ritter; acc. to Brambach, s. v., the two forms are different words, de-rigo meaning <sense id="n14128.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to give a particular direction to;</hi> di-rigo, <hi rend="ital">to arrange</hi> <cb n="DIRI" /> <hi rend="ital">in distinct lines, set</hi> or <hi rend="ital">move different ways;</hi> cf. describo and discribo. But the distinction is not observed in the MSS. and edd. generally), rexi, rectum, 3 (<hi rend="ital">perf. sync.</hi> direxti, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 57</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>dis-rego</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to lay straight, set in a straight line, to arrange, draw up</hi> (class.; cf.: guberno, collineo, teneo). </sense><sense id="n14128.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n14128.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">coronam si diviseris, arcus erit: si direxeris, virga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec directa materia injecta consternebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:17:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 17, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:46:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 46, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves ante portum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 31</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">naves in pugnam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vicos,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to build regularly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 55</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">castella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:12:26" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 12, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">molem recta fronte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:3" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 3</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">regiones lituo,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to lay out, bound</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 17</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">finem alicui veterem viam regiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 27</bibl></cit>.—Esp. freq.: <cit><quote lang="la">aciem,</quote> <trans><tr>to draw up the troops in battle array</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 8, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 47 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:28" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 1:12:3" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 1, 12, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:2:1:4" default="NO">2, 1, 4</bibl> et saep.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">frontem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:13:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 13, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:11" default="NO">5, 13, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">membrana plumbo derecta,</quote> <trans><tr>ruled with a lead-pencil</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:22:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 22, 7</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n14128.3" n="b" level="4"> Perh. i. q., <hi rend="ital">to split, cleave in twain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">elephantum machaeră dirigit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:3:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 3, 54</bibl></cit> (dub.); cf.: dirigere apud Plautum invenitur pro discidere, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=69:15" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 69, 15</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n14128.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic., with respect to the terminus, <hi rend="ital">to send in a straight line, to direct to</hi> a place (so most freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">ex vestigio vela ad castra Corneliana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:25:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 25, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aciem ad te,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cursum ad litora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:25:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 25, 4</bibl></cit>: iter ad Mutinam, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 112</bibl> et saep.—Afterwards more freq. with <hi rend="ital">in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">equum in consulem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">currum in hostem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tela manusque in corpus Aeacidae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 57</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 3:3:4" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 3, 3, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hastam in te,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 66</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">dentes in inguina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:400" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 400</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cursum in Africam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:19" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cursum per auras in lucos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 195</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">navem eo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Chabr. 4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Chabr. 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gressum huc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 162</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">11, 855</bibl> et saep.; and <usg type="style">poet.</usg> with the <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ilo hastam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:401" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 401</bibl></cit> et saep.—Without designating the limit: <cit><quote lang="la">ab iisdem (Etesiis) maritimi cursus (i. e. navium) celeres et certi diriguntur,</quote> <trans><tr>to be directed, steered</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter navis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:4" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cursum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 3:13:6" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 3, 13, 6</bibl></cit>; esp. freq. of weapons, <hi rend="ital">to aim, direct</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spicula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:497" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 497</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:606" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 606</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hastile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:490" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 490</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tela,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:9:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 9, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sagittas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:19" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 19</bibl></cit> et saep.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 140</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:92" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 92</bibl> Drak.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 35</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnera alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 160" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 160</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n14128.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n14128.6" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to set in order, arrange</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">materias divisione dirigere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:6:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 6, 1</bibl></cit>.—Far more freq. (esp. in Cic. and Quint.), </sense><sense id="n14128.7" n="B" level="2"> In partic.: aliquid ad or in aliquid; also: aliqua re, <hi rend="ital">to direct, guide, arrange</hi> a thing either <hi rend="ital">to</hi> something (as its aim, scope) or <hi rend="ital">according to</hi> something (as its rule or pattern). </sense><sense id="n14128.8" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: meas cogitationes sic dirigo, non ad illam parvulam Cynosuram sed, etc., Ac. 2, 20, 66; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">orationem ad exempla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Rep. 2:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 31 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 2, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicium ad ea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:5:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ad id quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:3:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 3, 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">se ad ea effingenda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:127" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecipua rerum ad famam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 40</bibl></cit> et saep.—In a different sense (viz., with ad equiv. to secundum, v. ad): <cit><quote lang="la">in verbis et eligendis et collocandis nihil non ad rationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:37:140" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 37, 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitam ad certam rationis normam,</quote> <trans><tr>to conform</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:chapter=2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leges hominum ad naturam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:chapter=2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n14128.9" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> (not so in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">tota mente (intentionem) in opus ipsum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">communes locos in vitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:1:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 1, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 3:2:2" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 3, 2, 2</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n14128.10" n="(g)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case> (only in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">quos (fines) utilitate aut voluptate dirigunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia voluptate,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 22, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utilitatem honestate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:21:83" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 21, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec normā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:49:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 49, 190</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14128.11" n="(d)" level="5"> Without an object: <cit><quote lang="la">(divinatio) ad veritatem saepissime dirigit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> —（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <case>acc.</case> only: epistolam (sc. ad aliquem), <hi rend="ital">to write</hi>, Capit. Clod. Alb. 2.—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">adversus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 7, 6</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">dīrectus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">dērectus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., made straight, straight, direct</hi>, whether horizontally or perpendicularly; <hi rend="ital">straight, level; upright, steep</hi>. </sense><sense id="n14128.12" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">auditus flexuosum iter habet, ne quid intrare possit, si simplex et directum pateret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:57:144" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 57, 144</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">aes (tubae), opp. flexum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:79:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 79, 2</bibl></cit>: latera, <cb n="DIRI" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:72:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 7, 72, 1</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">trabes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 23, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ordo (olearum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 8, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcus (opp. obliquus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paries,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>that cuts another at right angles</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:chapter=4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 4</bibl></cit>: ut directiores ictus flant, Quadrig. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:1:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 1, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeruptus locus utraque ex parte directus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:45:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 45, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 24, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Henna) ab omni aditu circumcisa atque directa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 48</bibl></cit> Zumpt <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 26</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">dī-rectum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a straight line</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in directo pedum VIII. esse, in anfracto XVI.,</quote> <trans><tr>in a straight line</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=15" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 15</bibl></cit> Müll.; so, <cit><quote lang="la">altitudo (montis) per directum IV. M. pass.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 22, 18, § 80</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:66 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 66 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cadere in directum moderate (with exire per devexum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 6:20" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 6, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:47:20 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 47, 20 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n14128.13" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">straightforward, unceremonious, open, simple, direct</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">o praeclaram beate vivendi et apertam et simplicem et directam viam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 18</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">iter ad laudem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:17:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 17, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vera illa et directa ratio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tristis ac directus senex,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 38</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quid est in judicio? Directum, asperum, simplex, SI PARET HS ICCC DARI,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">percunctatio et denuntiatio belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 19</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">contiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 38, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> (v. obliquus): <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 6, 23, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">actio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:5:46" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 3, 5, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:4:26" default="NO">9, 4, 26</bibl> et saep.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">institutio (opp. precaria),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:1:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 29, 1, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libertates (opp. fideicommissariae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:4:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 29, 4, 12</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi> </sense><sense id="n14128.14" n="a" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">dīrectē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">directly, straight</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:7:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. Or. 7, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:5:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 5, 22</bibl></cit>.—Far more freq., </sense><sense id="n14128.15" n="b" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">dīrectō</orth>, <hi rend="ital">directly, straight</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">deorsum ferri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">transversas trabes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad fidem spectare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:13:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part.
