Or. 13, 46</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 61 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> (opp. anfractus and circuitio); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 66" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:4:26 al" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 9, 4, 26 al.</bibl> —* </sense><sense id="n14128.16" n="c" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">dīrectā</orth>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo magis ursimus alte directā,</quote> <trans><tr>press deep down perpendicularly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 198</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14128.17" n="d" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">dīrectim</orth>, <hi rend="ital">straightway, directly</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 3, p. 34</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 12</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.—Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">directius gubernare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 20, 66</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi> seems not to occur either in the <pos>adj.</pos> or in the <pos>adv.</pos></sense></entryFree>
dirimo: <entryFree id="n14129" type="main" key="di^ri^mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭrĭmo</orth>, <itype>ēmi, emptum</itype> (<sense id="n14129.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> dirempsi, cited as error, <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> 220</bibl> P.), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>disĕmo, like diribeo, from dis-habeo</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to take apart; to part, separate, divide</hi> (class.; esp. freq. in the trop. sense—cf.: findo, scindo, divello, separo, sejungo, segrego, secerno). </sense><sense id="n14129.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">dirimi corpus distrahive,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 12</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1075" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1075</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tiberis Veientem agrum a Crustumino dirimens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 53</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">castris Ilerdam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 33</bibl></cit>: sontes justis (Minos), Claud. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Rufin.</author> 2, 477</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppida nostra unius diei itinere dirimuntur,</quote> <trans><tr>are separated from each other</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 8, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">urbs Vulturno flumine dirempta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 15</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">dirempta mari gens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:32" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 32</bibl></cit>; and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dirimente amne,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 39</bibl></cit> et saep.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of <hi rend="ital">cutting through</hi> the waves in a ship, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:482" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 482</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n14129.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n14129.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To break off, interrupt, to disturb, put off, delay</hi> (the fig. is taken from combatants who are parted asunder; transferred, like the opp. committere, to things; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">dirimere infestas acies, dirimere iras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 13</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">proelium tandem diremit nox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 99</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">proelium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 40 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 60 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:467 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 467 al.</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 9, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:52" default="NO" valid="yes">40, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 79</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">certamina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:314" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 314</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">controversiam,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to adjust, compose</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:33:119" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 33, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seditionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 1:8:6" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 1, 8, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem arbitrio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:98" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 6, 98</bibl></cit> et saep.; also, <hi rend="ital">to separate, dissolve, break off</hi> a connection: <cit><quote lang="la">conjunctionem civium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:5:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 5, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">societatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 2, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuptias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:43" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">affinitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitias,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 29</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:10:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 10, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caritatem quae est inter natos et parentes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:16:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 16, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">conubium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 6</bibl></cit> et saep.—So too, <hi rend="ital">to interrupt, disturb, break up</hi> a conversation, deliberation, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">colloquium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:46:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 46, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermonem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concilia populi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 36 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:59 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 59 al.</bibl></cit>; cf. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">actum est eo die nihil: nox diremit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 13, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14129.4" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to destroy, frustrate, bring to naught</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">natura animaï morte dirempta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auspicium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">rem susceptam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:12:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 12, 31</bibl></cit>: dirimere <pb n="585" /> <cb n="DIRU" /> tempus et proferre diem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:39:85" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 39, 85</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea res consilium diremit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 18</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.— Absnl., to dissuade, to be unfavorable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dirimen tibus auspicibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 10, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
diripio: <entryFree id="n14130" type="main" key="di_ri^pi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dī-rĭpĭo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, eptum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>rapio</etym>, <sense id="n14130.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to tear asunder, tear in pieces</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n14130.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (rarely): <cit><quote lang="la">Pentheum diripuisse aiunt Bacchas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hippolytum (equi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:338" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 338</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:310" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 5, 310</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec opinantes (leae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1319" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1319</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">membra manibus nefandis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:731" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 731</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">venti diripiunt fretum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:367" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 367</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n14130.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n14130.3" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="dom">Milit. t. t.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to lay waste, ravage, spoil, plunder</hi> an enemy's territory or possessions (so most freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">bona alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 3, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 42, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 43, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnum numerum frumenti commeatusque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 38, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impedimenta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 17, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves more praedonum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:112:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 112, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedas bellicas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 41:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 41, 7</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">oppidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 21, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 80</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 32 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">templa hostiliter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 21</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">castra hostiliter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 14</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">oppida hostiliter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:54" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 31 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">provincias,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 19, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 2, 3</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n14130.4" n="b" level="4"> With personal objects: <cit><quote lang="la">Eburones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:34:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 34, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 35, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lusitanos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Cato, 3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Cato, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab hostibus diripi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 8, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:12:4 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 12, 4 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n14130.5" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> beyond the milit. sphere, <hi rend="ital">to destroy, to rob</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Harpyiae) diripiunt dapes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 227</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supellectilem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14130.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To struggle, strive, contend for</hi> a thing (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">talos jecit in medium, quos pueri diripere coeperant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:47" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 47</bibl></cit>: editum librum, <hi rend="ital">to buy up rapidly</hi>, Suet. Vita Pers. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">diripitur ille toto foro patronus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Brev. Vit. 7</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">Timagenem, id. de Ira, 3, 23: Homerum (urbes),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Silv. 5, 3, 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">matrem avidis complexibus ambo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:722" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Th. 5, 722</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te potentiores per convivia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:76" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 76</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14130.7" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To tear away, snatch away</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">direpto ex capite regni insigni et lacerata veste,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:5:24" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 5, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum a latere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:5:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 5, 21</bibl> Stallb. (al. derepta). —</sense><sense id="n14130.8" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of the mind and feelings, <hi rend="ital">to distract, distress</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">differor, distrahor, diripior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 2, 1, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
diritas: <entryFree id="n14131" type="main" key="di_ri^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīrĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>dirus</etym> (rare but class.), lit. fearfulness, viz., <sense id="n14131.0" n="I" level="1"> Of fate, <hi rend="ital">fatal mischief, misfortune</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si qua invecta diritas casu foret, Cic. Poët. Tusc. 3, 14: totius diei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">ominis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:9:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 9, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14131.1" n="II" level="1"> Of character, <hi rend="ital">fierceness, cruelty</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omni diritate atque immanitate teterrimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:chapter=3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Vatin. 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quanta in altero diritas, in altero comitas!</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morum (Tiberii),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dirumpo: <entryFree id="n14132" type="main" key="di_rumpo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dī-rumpo</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">disr-</orth>, <itype>rūpi, ruptum, 3</itype>, <sense id="n14132.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to break</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dash to pieces; to break, burst asunder</hi> (rare but class.). </sense><sense id="n14132.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabulā caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne medius disrumpar miser,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 2, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum se in nubem induerint (venti) ejusque tenuissimam quamque partem coeperint dividere atque disrumpere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:19:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 19, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imagines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 55</bibl></cit>: homo diruptus, i. e. <hi rend="ital">that has a rupture</hi> (c. c. dirutus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 12</bibl>.—In an obscene sense, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:3:11 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 4, 3, 11 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n14132.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n14132.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To break off, sunder, sever</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitias exorsa aliqua offensione dirumpimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:chapter=22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 22 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">humani generis societatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:5:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 5, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,013:11:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 3 Reg. 11, 11</bibl></cit>.—And in a figure borrowed from a play (in which two persons tugged at the ends of a rope until it broke, or one of them fell to the ground): <cit><quote lang="la">cave dirumpatis, i. e. the rope or thread of your recollection,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. prol. 117</bibl></cit>.— Esp. freq., </sense><sense id="n14132.4" n="B" level="2"> Pass. in colloquial lang., <hi rend="ital">to burst</hi> with envy, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">unum omnia posse dirumpuntur ii qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:16:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 16, 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">infinito fratris tui plausu dirumpitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 12, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dirumpor dolore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 12, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">risu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 130, 3</bibl></cit>.—Once <hi rend="ital">act.</hi>: dirupi me paene, <hi rend="ital">I nearly burst myself</hi> with earnest speaking, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 1, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
diruo: <entryFree id="n14133" type="main" key="di_ru^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dī-rŭo</orth>, <itype>rŭi, rŭtum, 3</itype>, <sense id="n14133.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to tear asunder, overthrow, demolish, destroy</hi> (class. —cf.: deleo, diluo, exstinguo, everto, demolior). </sense><sense id="n14133.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">maceriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 7, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:40:73" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 40, 73</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:8:section=25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 8, § 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:54" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:551" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 551</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">muros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,009:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Con. 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">templa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:60" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcum circi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">monumentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:30:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 30, 4</bibl>: <cb n="DIS" /> fores ira, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 9, 14: <cit><quote lang="la">arbusta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:363" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 363</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regna Priami,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:28:54" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 28, 54</bibl></cit> (3, 26, 8 M.); cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 1, 113 et saep.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">diruit, aedificat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 100</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nova diruunt, alia aedificant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 20:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 20, 12</bibl></cit>.—Hyperbol.: caelum, Auct. B. Hisp. 42 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n14133.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">agmina vasto impetu,</quote> <trans><tr>to drive asunder, scatter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:14:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 14, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia Bacchanalia,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to abolish</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 18</bibl></cit>.—And in milit. lang.: aere dirutus, qs. ruined in pay, i. e. <hi rend="ital">deprived of pay;</hi> said of a soldier whose pay was stopped as a punishment, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 532, 4 sq.</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 13</bibl> Zumpt; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also beyond the milit. sphere, and without aere, of a bankrupt: homo diruptus dirutusque,</quote> <trans><tr>both ruptured and bankrupt</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
diruptio: <entryFree id="n14134" type="hapax" key="di_rupti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīruptĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>dirumpo</etym>, <sense id="n14134.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tearing asunder, tearing to pieces</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnorum corporum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:15" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
diruptus: <entryFree id="n14135" type="main" key="di_ruptus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīruptus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from dirumpo.</entryFree>
dirus: <entryFree id="n14136" type="main" key="di_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. root dī, to flee; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">de/os, dei/dw, deino/s</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n14136.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fearful, awful</hi> (for syn. cf.: saevus, atrox, ferox, crudelis, trux, furens, furiosus, immitis). </sense><sense id="n14136.1" n="I" level="1"> Orig. belonging to the lang. of augurs; of fate, <hi rend="ital">ill-omened, ominous, boding, portentous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">QVAE AVGVR INIVSTA, NEFASTA VITIOSA DIRA DEFIXERIT, IRRITA INFECTAQVE SVNTO,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tristissima exta sine capite fuerunt, quibus nihil videtur esse dirius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 15</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">bubo, dirum mortalibus omen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:550" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 550</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 56</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:92" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 92</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:1:3:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 1, 3, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:22" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 1, 1, § 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">somnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:59" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus, Cic. Poët. Div. 1, 11, 18: exsecrationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 56</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:22" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 12</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">deprecationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 2, 4, § 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">detestatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:89" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ritus sacrorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">religio loci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:350" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 350</bibl></cit> et saep.—Hence, as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: </sense><sense id="n14136.2" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">dīrae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> </sense><sense id="n14136.3" n="(a)" level="5"> (sc. res), <hi rend="ital">ill-boding things, portents, unlucky signs</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dirarum obnuntiatio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 2, 4, § 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:26" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 2, 5, § 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:24 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 24 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:89" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 89</bibl>; Müll. Etrusk. 2, p. 117.—</sense><sense id="n14136.4" n="(b)" level="5"> As a <hi rend="ital">nom. propr.</hi>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dīrae</orth>, <hi rend="ital">the Furies</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:845 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 845 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 473</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:804" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 804</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Epit. 21 al" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Epit. 21 al.</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">called also Dirae deae, sorores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:324" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 324</bibl></cit> and 454.—</sense><sense id="n14136.5" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">dīra</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">fearful things, ill-boding events</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in dira et in vitiosa incurrimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:16:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 16, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:8:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 8, 21</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">me mihi dira precari cogis,</quote> <trans><tr>to curse, invoke curses on</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:6:17" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dira passus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Sirach, 38, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n14136.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of character, <hi rend="ital">dreadful, horrible, terrible, abominable, detestable</hi> (so almost exclusively <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; a very favorite expression with the Aug. poets; in the Ciceron. per. not at all; but cf. diritas, II.): senex dirissimus, Varr. Poët. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 100, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dea,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Circe</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:278" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 278</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ulixes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:261" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 261</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">762</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hannibal,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:12:2 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 12, 2 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">durum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 6, 36</bibl></cit> (also ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:2:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 2, 9</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">Afer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:4:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 4, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Amulius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:53" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noverca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:12:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 12, 188</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pellex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 60</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">hydra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serpens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:651" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 651</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:334" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 1, 334</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parens,</quote> <trans><tr>fell, cruel</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:383" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 383</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">soror,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:3:84" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 3, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parentes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 5, 541</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14136.7" n="b" level="4"> Of inanimate and abstr. subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">regio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:3:5" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:553" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 1, 553</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dapes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:663" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 663</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:61" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 61</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 9, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Asphaltites lacus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 15, 15, § 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scopulus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 11, 18, § 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duarum Syrtium vadoso mari diri sinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 4, 4, § 26</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:217" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 217</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nefas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 563</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollicitudines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:13:10" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 13, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:426" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 426</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superbia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:354" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 354</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 65</bibl></cit> et saep.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, answering to the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">deino/s</foreign>, with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dira portas quassare trabs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:284" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 284</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14136.8" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Skilful</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in complicandis negotiis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 5, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dirutio: <entryFree id="n14137" type="gloss" key="di_ru^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīrŭtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>diruo</etym>, <sense id="n14137.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a destruction</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 3, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dirutus: <entryFree id="n14138" type="main" key="di_ru^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīrŭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from diruo.</entryFree>
dis: <entryFree id="n14139" type="main" key="di_s1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīs</orth>, <itype>dītis</itype>, <sense id="n14139.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., rich</hi>, v. dives.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n14140" type="main" key="Di_s2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dīs</orth>, <itype>ītis</itype> (<case>nom.</case> Dītis, Petr. Poët. 120, 76; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:34" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 34</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 6, 273</bibl>; the <case>nom.</case> Dis very rare in the poets; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyl. 12</bibl>: de deis, 3), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>cf.: dīus, divus, deus</etym>, orig. denoting <sense id="n14140.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">godhead, deity</hi>, in general, and of <hi rend="ital">Jupiter</hi> in partic.; cf.: Diespiter and Diovis = Juppiter; afterwards exclusively as the designation of <hi rend="ital">the god of the infernal regions</hi>, the Greek <hi rend="ital">Pluto</hi>, connected<cb n="DISC" />  with pater, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=66" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 66</bibl> Müll.; identified by Caesar with the Celtic god of night, cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:18:1 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 18, 1 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 84 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1465</bibl>-1470 and 4967; <cit><quote lang="la">without pater,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:519" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 519</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:702" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 4, 702</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 731</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 127 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pallida Ditis aqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:1:28" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ditis ignava aqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:3:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 3, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:438" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 438</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">511</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:449 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 449 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">domina Ditis = Proserpina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:397" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 397</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n14141" type="main" key="di^s3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭs</orth>, <itype>an inseparable particle</itype> <etym>Sanscr. dva, two: dvis, twice; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">di/s</foreign> (<foreign lang="greek">dvis</foreign>); cf.: bis, bini, dubius, duo; also Sanscr. vi- (for dvi-) = dis-</etym>, occurs before vowels only in dishiasco; it stands unchanged before <sense id="n14141.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">c, p, q, t, s</hi>, and <hi rend="ital">di;</hi> loses its <hi rend="ital">s</hi> before <hi rend="ital">b, d, g, l, m, n, r</hi>, and <hi rend="ital">v;</hi> and becomes <hi rend="ital">dif</hi>-before <gen>f.</gen> So, discedo, dispar, disquiro, distraho, dissolvo; dibalo, dido, digero, dilabor, dimetior, dinumero, dirigo, divello, etc. Before <hi rend="ital">j (i)</hi> we have sometimes <hi rend="ital">dī-</hi>, as in dijudico, dijungo, and sometimes <hi rend="ital">dis-</hi>, as in disjeci, disjungo. Iacio makes disicio or dissicio. In late Lat. disglutino and disgrego occur; while disrumpo occurs in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:22:85" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 22, 85</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">dirrumpo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 37</bibl></cit>: dirripio in <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 19, 37</bibl>, in some MSS.; and dimminuo in MSS. of Plautus, v. Neue Formenl. 2, 782 sq.—</sense><sense id="n14141.1" n="II" level="1"> Meaning. </sense><sense id="n14141.2" n="A" level="2"> Dis, in most cases, answers to our <hi rend="ital">asunder, in pieces, apart, in two, in different directions</hi>, implying separation or division, as in: diffindo, diffugio, digero, discedo, discepto, discerno, discerpo, discindo, dido, diffindo, dimitto, dirumpo, divido, and a multitude of others.—</sense><sense id="n14141.3" n="B" level="2"> Less freq. = Engl. un-, reversing or negativing the meaning of the primitive, as in discingo, disconduco, disconvenio, diffido, diffiteor, disjungo, displiceo, dissimulo, dissocio, dissuadeo, and a few others; so, dinumero, <hi rend="ital">to count as separate objects</hi>: disputo, <hi rend="ital">to discuss</hi> different views or things. —</sense><sense id="n14141.4" n="C" level="2"> In a few words dis- acquires an intensive force, <hi rend="ital">exceedingly</hi>, as, differtus, dilaudo, discupio, disperio (<hi rend="ital">utterly</hi>), dispudet, dissuavior, distaedet. This is but a development of its original meaning: thus, differtus is properly <hi rend="ital">stuffed out;</hi> dilaudo, <hi rend="ital">to scatter praise of</hi>, etc.—</sense><sense id="n14141.5" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Between, among, through</hi>: dinosco, dirigo (or derigo), dijudico, diligo, dilucesco, dispicio, dissereno.</sense></entryFree>
discalceatus: <entryFree id="n14142" type="main" key="discalce^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-calcĕātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n14142.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., unshod, barefooted</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:51" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:25:10 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Deut. 25, 10 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
discapedino: <entryFree id="n14143" type="hapax" key="disca^pe_di^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-căpēdĭno</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>capedo</etym>, manus, <sense id="n14143.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to hold the hands apart</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 3, p. 141</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
discaveo: <entryFree id="n14144" type="hapax" key="disca^ve^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-căvĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <sense id="n14144.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to be on one's guard against, keep away from, beware of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">malo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 1, 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
discedo: <entryFree id="n14145" type="main" key="disce_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-cēdo</orth>, <itype>cessi, cessum, 3</itype> (<sense id="n14145.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf. sync.</hi> discesti, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 1, 3</bibl>), <pos>v. n.</pos> </sense><sense id="n14145.1" n="I" level="1"> (With the notion of dis predominating.) </sense><sense id="n14145.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To part asunder, divide, separate</hi> (rare but class.; cf.: linquo, relinquo, desero, desum, destituo, deficio). </sense><sense id="n14145.3" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum terra discessisset magnis quibusdam imbribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelum,</quote> <trans><tr>opens</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:43:97" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 43, 97</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 44, 99</bibl>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">clears off</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 20</bibl> (this last is quoted in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 7:20" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 7, 20</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">sulcus vomere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:382" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 382</bibl></cit>: VT SODALITATES DECVRIATIQVE DISCEDERENT, SC. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 3, 5</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum discedere populum jussissent tribuni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populus ex contione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 34 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: armati in latitudinem, Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 99, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in duas partes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in partes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 49</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in manipulos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fumus in auras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:436" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 436</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad semina rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:833" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 833</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palus multos discessit in amnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:360" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 360</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">citius paterer caput hoc discedere collo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:6:7" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 6, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14145.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">divisio in tres partes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:58" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec in duo genera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:86" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 6, 86</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14145.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To part from</hi> one's connection with one, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to leave, forsake, desert</hi> (rare but class.).—With <hi rend="ital">a</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>: uxor a Dolabella discessit, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab amicis in re publica peccantibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:12:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 12, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab amicis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 20, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a nobis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:60:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 60, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites in itinere ab eo discedunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a Perseo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n14145.6" n="II" level="1"> (With the notion of cedere predominating.) <hi rend="ital">To depart from</hi> any place or person, <hi rend="ital">to go away from, to leave</hi> (cf.: proficiscor, abeo; so most frequently in all periods and sorts of composition). </sense><sense id="n14145.7" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n14145.8" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: constr. with <hi rend="ital">ab, ex</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, rarely with <hi rend="ital">de</hi>—With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>: cum discesti ab <pb n="586" /> <cb n="DISC" /> hero, atque abisti ad forum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 1, 3</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">so with abire,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 3, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod legati eorum paulo ante a Caesare discesserant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab suis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab exercitu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 9, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 9, 3</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">a senis latere numquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a vallo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:37:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 37, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab loco,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 34, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a litore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 8</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> et saep.—With <hi rend="ital">ex</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non modo illum e Gallia non discessisse, sed ne a Mutina quidem recessisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 8, 7, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex contione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:33:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 33, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">e medio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">e patria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:3:85" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 3, 85</bibl></cit> et saep.—With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de foro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:65:section=147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 65, § 147</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4, 22, § 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:29:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 29, 79</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de colloquio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 40</bibl></cit>.—With <case>abl.</case> without a <pos>prep.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">templo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:381" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 381</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">finibus Ausoniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:3:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 1, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lecto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:1:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tarracone,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:21:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 21, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Capua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 21</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille discessit, ego somno solutus sum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 26 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:39:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 39, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 22 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 8</bibl> et saep.—<hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne longius ab agmine discedi pateretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:19:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 19, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab concilio disceditur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 2</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de colloquio discessum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 87 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 44 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n14145.9" n="b" level="4"> Designating the term. ad quem, <hi rend="ital">to go away to</hi> any place: <cit><quote lang="la">in silvas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:39:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 39, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex fuga in civitates,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 88</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in castra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:83:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 83, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in proximos colles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 54 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in loca occulta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 56:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 56, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad urbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 184</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">Capreas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex castris domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 7, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">simply domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 13, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 87, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">domos suas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:4:2 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 4, 2 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cubitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 10</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n14145.10" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n14145.11" n="a" level="4"> In milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">to march off, march away, decamp</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">discessit a Brundisio obsessionemque nostrorum omisit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 24 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab Gergovia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 7, 43 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a mari Dyrrhachioque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:44:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 44, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab Zama,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 61 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 61 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex ea parte vici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex hibernis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 28, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex eo loco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:30:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 30, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ex iis locis cum classe,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 101</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tarracone,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 21, 5</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">dispersi ac dissipati discedunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:58:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 58, 3</bibl></cit>; so <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 53</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 6, 33, 4 et saep.; <cit><quote lang="la">so milit.: discedere ab signis,</quote> <trans><tr>to quit the standard, leave the order of battle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 16, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:44:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 44, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui discedere et abire cœptabant,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to break ranks and go away</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: ab ordinibus signisque <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 1:5:3" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 1, 5, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab armis,</quote> <trans><tr>to lay down one's arms</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:41:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 41, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 9, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 34:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 34, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:11:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 8, 11, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:14 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 14 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n14145.12" n="b" level="4"> Also in milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">to get away, come away, come off</hi> in any manner from the battle (victorious, conquered, wounded, etc.); and sometimes to be translated simply <hi rend="ital">to become, to be</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">superiores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:47:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 47, 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">superior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 39:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 39, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:47:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 47, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">victor ab hoste,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victus,</quote> <trans><tr>to be conquered</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 49:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 49, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">graviter vulneratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 61:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 61, 7</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">aequo proelio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:112:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 112, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aequa manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 39:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 39, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequo Marte cum Volscis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine detrimento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:46:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 46, 6</bibl></cit> et saep.—<hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">a proelio disceditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:6:7:12" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 6, 7, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14145.13" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> beyond the milit. sphere (freq. into the judicial sphere, on account of its analogy to the former): <cit><quote lang="la">ut spoliis Sexti Roscii hoc judicio ornati auctique discedant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:chapter=3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superiorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 1, 2</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">liberatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,019:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Phoc. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium judicio probatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:64:229" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 64, 229</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impunita (tanta injuria),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 30</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">discessisses non male,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:2:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 2, 70</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pulchre et probe et praeter spem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:8:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 8, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut cum summa gloria aut sine molestia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">a judicio capitis maximā gloriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita tum discedo ab illo, ut qui se filiam Neget daturum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 121</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">si possum discedere, ne causa optima in senatu pereat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense><sense id="n14145.14" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n14145.15" n="1" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to depart, deviate, swerve from; to leave, forsake, give up</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil a statu naturae, nihil a dignitate sapientis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:20:67" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 20, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a fide justitiaque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 20, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longe ab consuetudine mea et cautione ac diligentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a constantia atque a mente, atque a se ipse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:55:114" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 55, 114</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">a se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:79:273" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 79, 273</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:11:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 11, 33</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 5, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:6:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 6, 11</bibl>: a recta conscientia, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">a sua sententia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: ab officio,<cb n="DISC" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:40:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 1, 40, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab oppugnatione castrorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:31:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 31, 3</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">a judiciisque causisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:33:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 33, 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a litteris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab illa acerrima contentione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:chapter=31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab illa cavillatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a suscepta semel persuasione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 2, 26</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n14145.16" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n14145.17" n="a" level="4"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">to pass away, to vanish, to cease</hi> (very rarely): <cit><quote lang="la">modo audivi, quartanam a te discessisse,</quote> <trans><tr>had left you</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex animo memoria alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 9</bibl></cit>: hostibus spes potiundi oppidi discessit (opp. studium propugnandi <hi rend="ital">accessit</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 7, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi hae sollicitudines discessere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 52 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n14145.18" n="b" level="4"> In alicujus sententiam, in polit. lang., <hi rend="ital">to pass</hi> or <hi rend="ital">go over to another's opinion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 55:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 55, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:45" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 45</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">the opp., in alia omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 12, 3</bibl></cit> (v. alius). In like manner: <cit><quote lang="la">decurritur ad illud extremum atque ultimum SC., quo nisi paene in ipso urbis incendio ... numquam ante discessum est,</quote> <trans><tr>which had never before been resorted to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 5, 3</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so perh.: ex oratione Caesaris ... hanc in opinionem discessi, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n14145.19" n="c" level="4"> Ab aliquo, in Cicero's letters in the sense of <hi rend="ital">to leave out of consideration</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to except</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum a vobis meae salutis auctoribus discesserim, neminem esse, cujus officiis me tam esse devinctum confitear,</quote> <trans><tr>if I except you, you excepted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut cum ab illo discesserint, me habeant proximum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amoris erga me, cum a fraterno amore domesticoque discessi, tibi primas defero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:17:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 17, 5</bibl></cit>.!*? Once in the <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>: custodibus discessis, Cael. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 869</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
discentia: <entryFree id="n14146" type="main" key="discenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">discentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>disco</etym>, <sense id="n14146.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a learning</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 23</bibl> and 24.</sense></entryFree>
disceptatio: <entryFree id="n14147" type="main" key="discepta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">disceptātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>discepto</etym>, <sense id="n14147.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dispute, disputation, debate, discussion, disquisition</hi>. </sense><sense id="n14147.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (good prose in sing. and plur.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">for syn.: controversia, concertatio, altercatio, contentio, jurgium, rixa, disputatio): cum quibus omnis fere nobis disceptatio contentioque est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:72:150" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 72, 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non disceptatio modo, sed etiam altercatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 32</bibl></cit>; so <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:11:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 11, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 2, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rationum et firmamentorum contentio adducit in angustum disceptationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:30:104" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. Or. 30, 104</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:40" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:11:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 11, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:5:2 al" default="NO">7, 5, 2 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lator ipse legis, cum esset controversia nulla facti, juris tamen disceptationem esse voluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 9, 23</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">juris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:82" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">forenses judiciorum aut deliberationum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:6:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 6, 22</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicationum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:11:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 11, 19</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">verborum (opp.: directa denuntiatio belli),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cogitationum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Rom. 14, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14147.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">a decision, judicial award, judgment</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">arbitrorum (coupled with publica judicia),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:43" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:15:8:section=24" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 2, 15, 8, § 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
disceptator: <entryFree id="n14148" type="main" key="discepta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">disceptātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>discepto</etym>, <sense id="n14148.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an umpire, arbitrator, judge</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">disceptator id est rei sententiaeque moderator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:3:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. Or. 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">IVRIS DISCEPTATOR, QVI PRIVATA IVDICET IVDICARIVE IVBEAT, PRAETOR ESTO,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:3:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec vero quisquam privatus erat disceptator aut arbiter litis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:5:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 5, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:chapter=15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 5, 2, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 38, 97</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 1, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 26, 2</bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:37:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 37, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:23" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 23</bibl>; Asin. Pollio ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:132 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 132 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
disceptatrix: <entryFree id="n14149" type="main" key="discepta_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">disceptātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>disceptator</etym>, <sense id="n14149.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female umpire, arbitrator, judge</hi> (very rare): dialectica veri et falsi quasi disceptatrix et judex, * <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 28, 91</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Commod. 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
discepto: <entryFree id="n14150" type="main" key="discepto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">discepto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>dis and capio</etym>. <sense id="n14150.0" n="I" level="1"> Jurid. t. t. (lit., to seize hold of and separate; hence, to stop the dispute), <hi rend="ital">to decide, determine, judge</hi> a controversy, = dijudicare (cf.: dissero, disputo; <cit><quote lang="la">good prose, but rare): res juste sapienterque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:chapter=9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc causam si in foro dicerem eodem audiente et disceptante te,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 2, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ipso exercitu disceptante,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus dicebat disceptabatque controversias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 41, 20</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">controversias inter se jure ac judicio, aut ... bello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 38, 38 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter populum Carthaginiensem et regem in re praesenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 62 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter amicos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:15:2. al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 15, 2. al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">FETIALES BELLA DISCEPTANTO,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to decide between peace and war</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 9</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n14150.1" n="B" level="2"> Beyond the judic. sphere: cum Academici eorum controversias<cb n="DISC" />  disceptarent, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:3:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 3, 6</bibl>.—Far more freq.,.</sense><sense id="n14150.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of the parties themselves: <hi rend="ital">to debate, dispute, discuss, strive</hi>. </sense><sense id="n14150.3" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de controversiis jure apud se potius, quam inter se armis disceptare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B.
