G. 3, 107 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">de controversiis suis jure potius quam bello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; and see under <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign>: <cit><quote lang="la">non de aliquo crimine sed de publico jure,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:28:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 28, 64</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">de foederum jure verbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de jure vectigalium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de cunctis negotiis inter se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 11:2 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 11, 2 al.</bibl></cit>—Ellipt.: <cit><quote lang="la">damni (i. e. de actione damni) disceptare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:19:28:section=12" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 19, 28, § 12</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quanto periculo de jure publico disceptaretur armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 14, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 1, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum de re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:43:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 43, 183</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de omnibus condicionibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 24 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de agro cum regis legatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:62 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 62 al.</bibl></cit>—With <hi rend="ital">ob</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ob rem pecuniariam cum aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 5</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14150.4" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">erat non jure, non legibus, non disceptando decertandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:chapter=36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 36</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">cum palaestritis aequo jure,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 15</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">jure potius quam bellum gerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 85" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 85 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 65</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut coram imperatore, sicut inter Marcellum Siculosque disceptatum fuerat, disceptaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 33</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 38, 35</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Abl. absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multum invicem disceptato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 14</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n14150.5" n="B" level="2"> With inanimate subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">in uno proelio omnis fortuna rei publicae disceptat,</quote> <trans><tr>depends upon, is at stake</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
discernenter: <entryFree id="n14151" type="main" key="discernenter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">discernenter</orth>, <sense id="n14151.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adv., with a distinction</hi>, etc.; v. discerno, <hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
discernibilis: <entryFree id="n14152" type="hapax" key="discerni^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">discernĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>discerno</etym>, <sense id="n14152.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be distinguished, discernible</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">similitudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Enchir. 90" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Enchir. 90</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
discerniculum: <entryFree id="n14153" type="main" key="discerni^cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">discernĭcŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. * <sense id="n14153.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The bodkin in a woman's head-dress, which parted the hair, a hair-bodkin</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 35, 31</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=129" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 129</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n14153.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a difference</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">coloris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:15:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 15, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Apol. Dav. Alt. 4, 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
discerno: <entryFree id="n14154" type="main" key="discerno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-cerno</orth>, <itype>crēvi, crētum, 3</itype>, <sense id="n14154.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to separate, set apart.</hi> </sense><sense id="n14154.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to separate, part, divide</hi> (freq. since the Aug. per.): <cit><quote lang="la">equas, ne inter se pugnare possint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:7:10" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 7, 10</bibl></cit>: ordines (preceded by senatus a populo <hi rend="ital">secretus</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 54</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lignum a carnibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 4, 7, § 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lusitaniam a Baetica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 21, 35, § 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque mons erat, qui fines eorum discerneret,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to mark out, determine</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 79:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 79, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <usg type="style">poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(saxum) telas auro,</quote> <trans><tr>to interweave with gold</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:264" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 264</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">11, 75</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec ipsa fortuna huc illucve discernit,</quote> <trans><tr>divides, distributes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 3</bibl></cit>.—In the <hi rend="ital">part. perf., divided, separated</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">duae urbes, magno inter se spatio discretae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 39 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Peraea a ceteris Judaeis Jordane amne,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 14, 15, § 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Philippus mari tantum Ionio discretus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 33</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">sol tanto intervallo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 11, 8, § 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uxor velo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:19:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 4, 19, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager saxo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:559" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 559</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decurias pluribus nominibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 2, 7, § 31</bibl></cit> et saep.— Of the hair, <hi rend="ital">parted</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">discretaque collo Caesaries,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyn. 272</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divisa discretaque tellus,</quote> <trans><tr>divided and separated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1441" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1441</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tellus (opp. permixta),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:691" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 691</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi discretas insula rumpit aquas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:194" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 194</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedes piorum,</quote> <trans><tr>set apart, retired</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:13:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 13, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae cum sint turpissima discreta ac separata, turpius junguntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">septem discretus in ostia Nilus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:324" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 324</bibl></cit> (for which: septem <hi rend="ital">digestum</hi> in cornua Nilum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:774" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 774</bibl>); cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 1, 1</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n14154.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n14154.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To separate</hi> things according to their different qualities, <hi rend="ital">to distinguish between, discern</hi> (freq. and class.): <cit><quote lang="la">alba et atra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:39:114" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 39, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">discernere et dispicere insidiatorem et petitum insidiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus et injuriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">probanda atque improbanda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:2:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fas atque nefas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:18:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 18, 11</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">id quod visum erit a falso,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 8, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pantheras a pardis solo candore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 17, 23, § 63</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">verba discerni articulatim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:555" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 555</bibl></cit>: suos, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 75</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">piceam visu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 10, 18, § 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temperantiam duobus modis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:22:77" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. Or. 22, 77</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">animus discernit, quid sit ejusdem generis, quid alterius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Univ. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniae an famae minus parceret haud facile dis cerneres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 25:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 25, 3</bibl></cit>; so with <hi rend="ital">an</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 5, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 25</bibl>; cf.: nec discernatur, jussu injussu imperatoris pugnent,<pb n="587" /> <cb n="DISC" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 34 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n14154.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To determine, settle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">limes agro positus litem ut discerneret arvis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:898" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 898</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">discerne causam meam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:42:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 42, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14154.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To except, omit</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 8, 7</bibl>.—Hence, * </sense><sense id="n14154.6" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">discernen-ter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">adv., with a distinction</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:4" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 4</bibl>, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> 81.—</sense><sense id="n14154.7" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">discrētim</orth>, <hi rend="ital">adv., separately, distinctly</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 173</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">singillatim ac discretim,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Flor. 9, p. 347</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adoriri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 29, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tradi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 28, 1</bibl></cit>; Hilar. in Psa. 138, 23.</sense></entryFree>
discerpo: <entryFree id="n14155" type="main" key="discerpo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-cerpo</orth>, <itype>psi, ptum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>carpo</etym>, <sense id="n14155.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to pluck</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tear in pieces, to rend, to mangle</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n14155.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus nec secerni nec dividi nec discerpi nec distrahi potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:29:71" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 29, 71</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:11:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 11, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter orgia Bacchi discerptum iuvenem sparsere per agros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:522" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 522</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">semiustum cadaver (canes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">membra gruis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 86</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">in parvas partīs aurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:829" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 829</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Judic. 4, 6 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n14155.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to scatter, disperse, destroy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae cuncta aërii discerpunt irrita venti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 142</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:313" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 313</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14155.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n14155.4" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">divulsa et quasi discerpta contrectare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:6:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 6, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem quae proposita est, quasi in membra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:5:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 5, 28</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n14155.5" n="B" level="2"> In partic. (like carpo, II. B.; concerpo, II.), <hi rend="ital">to tear in pieces</hi> with words, <hi rend="ital">to revile</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">me infestis dictis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:66:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 66, 73</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">lacerare carmina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:16:1" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 16, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
discerptio: <entryFree id="n14156" type="main" key="discerpti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">discerptĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>discerpo</etym>, <sense id="n14156.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tearing in pieces, rending</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">discerptiones eorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 4</bibl></cit> Esdr. 12, 32: <cit><quote lang="la">juris humani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:24:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 24, 10</bibl></cit> Madvig. (al. dissertio).</sense></entryFree>
discessio: <entryFree id="n14157" type="main" key="discessi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">discessĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>discedo</etym>. <sense id="n14157.0" n="I" level="1"> (Very rarely), <hi rend="ital">a separation</hi> of married persons, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 3, 36</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of the people into parties (with seditio),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stellarum et discessiones et coetus,</quote> <trans><tr>separations and conjunctions</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:1:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 14, 1, 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">plebei a patribus, et aliae dissensiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. Fragm. 1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. Fragm. 1, 9</bibl></cit> Dietsch.—</sense><sense id="n14157.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A going away, departure, removal</hi>. </sense><sense id="n14157.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (very rarely; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">discessus): Nonanus desolatus aliorum discessione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 30 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">necessaria,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 5, 3</bibl></cit>.—Far more freq., </sense><sense id="n14157.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n14157.4" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="dom">Polit. t. t.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a going over</hi> to any one in voting: <cit><quote lang="la">senatusconsultum de supplicatione per discessionem fecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:31" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 31</bibl>; cf. Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:7:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 7, 12</bibl>.—Esp.: discessionem facere, <hi rend="ital">to make a division</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to get the vote of the house by dividing it</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 14, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:52" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 52 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:8:53" default="NO">8, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:34:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 34, 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 69 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> al.—</sense><sense id="n14157.5" n="2" level="3"> In the church, <hi rend="ital">a separation, schism</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:21:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 21, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2</bibl> Thes. 2, 3.</sense></entryFree>
discessus: <entryFree id="n14158" type="main" key="discessus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">discessus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from discedo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n14159" type="main" key="discessus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">discessus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>discedo</etym>. <sense id="n14159.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A going asunder, separation, opening</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">caeli,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>lightning</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:28:60" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 28, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est interitus quasi discessus et secretio ac diremptus earum partium, quae ante interitum junctione aliqua tenebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:29:71" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 29, 71</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14159.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A going away, departure, removal</hi>. </sense><sense id="n14159.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ut me levarat tuus adventus, sic discessus afflixit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 50</bibl></cit>: subitus (with praeceps profectio), Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 10, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab urbe,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> ib. 8, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeclarus e vita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:23:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 23, 47</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">latronis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:11:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 11, 30</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">ceterorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legatorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">discessu mugire boves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:215 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 215 al.</bibl></cit>—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">solis accessus discessusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:7:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 7, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14159.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n14159.4" n="1" level="3"> In milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">a marching away, marching off, decamping</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 14, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 4, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 20, 1</bibl> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 1:1:9" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 1, 1, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:1:5:25 al" default="NO">1, 5, 25 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n14159.5" n="2" level="3"> In Cic. applied to his <hi rend="ital">banishment</hi> from Rome: <cit><quote lang="la">cum, discessu meo, religionum jura polluta sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:17:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 17, 42</bibl></cit> (cf. absum); so id. de domo 32, 85.</sense></entryFree>
disceus: <entryFree id="n14160" type="greek" key="disce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">discĕus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">di/skos</foreign> (a quoit), <sense id="n14160.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sort of comet shaped like a quoit</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 25, 22, § 89</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
discidium: <entryFree id="n14161" type="main" key="disci^di^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">discĭdĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>discindo</etym>. <sense id="n14161.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A tearing asunder, dividing, parting</hi> (freq. in Lucr., elsewh. rare): <cit><quote lang="la">partibus ejus (sc. corporis) discidium parere et nexus exsolvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 220</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:249" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 249</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:452" default="NO" valid="yes">452</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:120" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 120</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">3, 839 al.: nubis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:293" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 293</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 27, 4 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n14161.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A separation of persons</hi> or <hi rend="ital">things, a disagreement, discord;</hi> also <hi rend="ital">divorce</hi> (freq. and class.; see <cb n="DISC" /> Madvig. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:13:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 13, 44</bibl>, and the Excurs. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> p. 812 sq.</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">neque per vinum umquam ex me exoritur discidium in convivio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 60</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:17:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 17, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:13:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 13, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui inter nos discidium volunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 2, 14</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of the separation of lovers (of man and wife),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:5:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 3, 5, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 2, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:29:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 29, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 86</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:530" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 530</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 79</bibl> et saep.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">divortia atque affinitatum discidia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">desiderium alicujus discidii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:18:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 18, 45</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:de Const. Sap. 8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> de Const. Sap. 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:chapter=21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicorum discidia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:21:78" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 21, 78</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 23</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">10, 35: ex cupiditatibus odia, discidia, discordiae, bella nascuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:13:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 13, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 12, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:16:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 16, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:60 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 60 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
discido: <entryFree id="n14162" type="main" key="disci_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-cīdo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>caedo</etym>, <sense id="n14162.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cut in pieces</hi> (very rare; <cit><quote lang="la">perh. only in the foll. passages): aliquod in multas partīs ferro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:659" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 659</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:669" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 669</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
discinctus: <entryFree id="n14163" type="main" key="discinctus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">discinctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from discingo.</entryFree>
discindo: <entryFree id="n14164" type="main" key="di_scindo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dī-scindo</orth>, <itype>cĭdi, cissum, 3</itype>, <sense id="n14164.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to tear</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cleave asunder, to cut asunder, divide, rend, tear</hi> (class.—for syn. cf.: findo, scindo, dirimo, divello, separo, secerno). </sense><sense id="n14164.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">salicem Graecam discindito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:40:2" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 40, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit> (quoted <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:16:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 16, 38</bibl>); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:84" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 84</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:42 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 42 al.</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">tunicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:47:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 47, 195</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">purpureos amictus manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:602" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 602</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 2, 20</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">maxillam ictu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:58" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:514" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 514</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nubem (vis venti),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:436" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 436</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cotem novaculā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:17:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 17, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 36</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">trabes aut saxa securibus cuneisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cunctantem flagellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:33" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 33</bibl></cit> et saep.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulli penitus discindere ferro contigit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14164.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">discissa cum corpore vis animai,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:639" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 639</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tales amicitiae sunt remissione usus eluendae et dissuendae magis quam discindendae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:21:76" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 21, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis oratio aut continua est aut inter respondentem et interrogantem discissa,</quote> <trans><tr>interrupted, divided</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 89:16" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 89, 16</bibl></cit>.—Rarely of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">discissi studiis turbulentis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 25, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 22, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">28, 4</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
discingo: <entryFree id="n14165" type="main" key="discingo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-cingo</orth>, <itype>nxi, nctum, 3</itype>, <sense id="n14165.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to ungird, deprive of the girdle</hi>. </sense><sense id="n14165.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">discinctā tunicā fugiendum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 132</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:41" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 41 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tunicati et discincti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:100" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam discingitur armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:34" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 34</bibl></cit>.—As a milit. punishment: <cit><quote lang="la">destrictis gladiis discinctos destituit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:24" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 24</bibl> and 100: cum tenues nuper Marius discinxerit Afros, <hi rend="ital">had disarmed</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">conquered</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:120" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 120</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">peltatam Amazona Scythico nodo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:101:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 101, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14165.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n14165.3" n="A" level="2"> In <hi rend="ital">verb finit.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi crede, in sinu est (Caesar), neque ego discingor,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>I do not neglect him, I endeavor to preserve his friendship</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 13</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 92" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 92 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">discinxit ratione dolos fraudesque resolvit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>discovered, detected</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:153" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 153</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut inter Methium et Paulum, quae veniunt in disceptationem, discingas,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>that thou wilt decide</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 2, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14165.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">discinctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">ungirt</hi>. </sense><sense id="n14165.5" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne glorietur accinctus aeque ac discinctus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>who has put off his armor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,013:20:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 3 Reg. 20, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14165.6" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n14165.7" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Voluptuous, effeminate</hi>, Afri, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:724" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 724</bibl>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n14165.8" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Slovenly, careless, negligent; loose, dissolute, reckless</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">discincti ludere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avarus ut Chremes, opp. discinctus ut nepos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:1:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 1, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Natta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:31" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:4:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">discincta in otia natus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:9:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 9, 41</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
disciplina: <entryFree id="n14166" type="main" key="disci_^pli_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">discī^plīna</orth> (also uncontr. DISCIPVLINA, Num. Hadr. ap. Eckh. D. N. V. 6, p. 503; the Cod. palimps. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 19</bibl>, prima manu has likewise DISCIPVLINA: so, <sense id="n14166.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">discipulina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:2:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 2, 75</bibl></cit> Lorenz; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 1, 3, 49</bibl> Fleck.; cf. Ussing ad loc.), ae. <gen>f.</gen> <etym>discipulus</etym>, <hi rend="ital">instruction, tuition, teaching</hi> in the widest sense of the word (for syn. cf.: ars, litterae, doctrina, scientia, cognitio, numanitas—very freq. and good prose). </sense><sense id="n14166.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad aliquem disciplinae causa concurrere (for which, shortly after: illo discendi causa proficisci),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 13, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 6, 14, 2</bibl> and 3: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui in disciplinam tradi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:41:92" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 41, 92</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eadem in litteris ratio est reliquisque rebus, quarum est disciplina,</quote> <trans><tr>are the objects of instruction</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:3:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cb n="DISC" /> puerilis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:4:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 4, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pueritiae disciplinae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 10, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praestantior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> et saep.</sense><sense id="n14166.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> (causa pro effectu), all that is taught in the way of instruction, whether with reference to single circumstances of life, or to science, art, morals, politics, etc., <hi rend="ital">learning, knowledge, science, discipline</hi>. </sense><sense id="n14166.3" n="A" level="2"> Object.: <cit><quote lang="la">caveto alienam disciplinam temere contemnas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:1:4" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui haec (sc. justitia, fides, aequitas, etc.) disciplinis informata, alia moribus confirmarunt, sanxerunt autem alia legibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totius familiae praecepta et instituta et disciplina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a pueris nullo officio aut disciplina assuefacti nihil omnino contra voluntatem faciant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 1, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 10, 4</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus prima aetas dedita disciplinis fuit iisque artibus, quibus instruimur ad hunc usum forensem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:30:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 30, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juris civilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:39:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 39, 18</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:chapter=10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:44:163" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 44, 163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">musices,</quote> <trans><tr>music</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis honesti justique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ruris,</quote> <trans><tr>agriculture</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:1:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 1, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">id. prooem. § 23 et saep.: militiae,</quote> <trans><tr>art of war, tactics</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 10, 28</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">bellica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:64:161" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 64, 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">militaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Iphicr. 1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Iphicr. 1</bibl></cit> and 2; esp. <hi rend="ital">military discipline</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:32" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34" default="NO" valid="yes">34</bibl>; 35; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:24" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 24</bibl> et saep.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: docuit, quid populi Romani disciplina atque opes possent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and with usus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 40, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domestica,</quote> <trans><tr>domestic discipline</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:48" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 48</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">domus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 65</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">rei publicae,</quote> <trans><tr>science of government, statesmanship</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:34:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 34, 159</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 33</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 38</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <cit><quote lang="la">3, 3 al.: disciplina philosophiae,</quote> <trans><tr>philosophical doctrines, philosophical system</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 32, 90</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:4:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 4, 20</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n14166.4" n="B" level="2"> Subject., <hi rend="ital">a custom, habit</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eademne erat haec disciplina tibi, quum tu adolescens eras?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eādem nos disciplinā utimur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 1, 3, 49</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 59</bibl> Ruhnk.: <cit><quote lang="la">imitatur malarum malam disciplinam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:5:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 5, 28</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">imitari, Castor, potius avi mores disciplinamque debebas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:chapter=10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 10</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Verr 2, 3, 68</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 1, 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 1, 1, 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
disciplinabilis: <entryFree id="n14167" type="main" key="disci_^pli_na_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">discī^plīnābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>disciplina</etym>, <sense id="n14167.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be learned</hi> by <hi rend="ital">teaching</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 4, 33</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 2, 24, 9</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">discī^plīnā-bĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in an instructive manner</hi>, Cassiod. in Psalt. praef. 4; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> in Psa. 150, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
disciplinatus: <entryFree id="n14168" type="main" key="disci_^pli_na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">discī^plīnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n14168.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">instructed, disciplined</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Jacob. 3, 13 al.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Alcim.</author> Avit. 4, 46</bibl>: disciplinatior, Tert. Fug. in persec. 1, <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
disciplinosus: <entryFree id="n14169" type="main" key="disci_^pli_no_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">discī^plīnōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n14169.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">docile</hi>: gladiator, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 463, 5</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:9:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 9, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
discipula: <entryFree id="n14170" type="main" key="disci^pu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">discĭpŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>; v. discipulus.</entryFree>
discipulatus: <entryFree id="n14171" type="main" key="disci^pu^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">discĭpŭlātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>discipulus</etym>, <sense id="n14171.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the condition of a disciple, discipleship</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Praescr. Haeret. 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 5, 40</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
discipulina: <entryFree id="n14172" type="main" key="disci^pu^li_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">discĭpŭlīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. disciplina <sense id="n14172.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
discipulus: <entryFree id="n14173" type="main" key="disci^pu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">discĭpŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>disco, and root of puer, pupilla; cf. Sanscr., putras, <hi rend="ital">son;</hi> Gr. <foreign lang="greek">pw=los</foreign>; Engl., <hi rend="ital">foal</hi></etym>, <sense id="n14173.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a learner, scholar, pupil, disciple</hi>. </sense><sense id="n14173.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:2:44 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 2, 44 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:3:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 23, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 7</bibl> et saep.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg> Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">discipulus est prioris posterior dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0622,001:120" default="NO"><author>Pub. Syr.</author> 120</bibl></cit> (Rib).—In the <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">discĭpŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <hi rend="ital">a female scholar</hi> or <hi rend="ital">disciple</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego te dedam discipulam cruci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:1:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 1, 1, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 11, 40, § 147</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:9:36 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 9, 36 al.</bibl>—Cf. transf., of the nightingale, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 29, 43, § 83</bibl>.—Of Latin eloquence: <cit><quote lang="la">Latina facundia similis Graecae ac prorsus ejus discipula videtur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 27</bibl></cit>.— —</sense><sense id="n14173.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A learner</hi> in an art or trade, <hi rend="ital">an apprentice</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 76</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">96</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 2, 8, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14173.3" n="III" level="1"> (Eccl. Lat.) <hi rend="ital">A disciple of Christ</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:5:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 5, 30</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
discissio: <entryFree id="n14174" type="main" key="discissi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">discissĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>discindo</etym>, <sense id="n14174.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a separation, division</hi> (late Lat., v. the class. discidium), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 261 al" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 261 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
discissura: <entryFree id="n14175" type="main" key="discissu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">discissūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n14175.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rending asunder, a rent</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">corporis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Serm. 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
discissus: <entryFree id="n14176" type="main" key="discissus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">discissus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from discindo.</entryFree>
discludo: <entryFree id="n14177" type="main" key="disclu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-clūdo</orth>, <itype>si, sum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>claudo</etym> (rare but classical; already obsolete in the <pb n="588" /> <cb n="DISC" /> time of Macrobius, v. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 4</bibl>). <sense id="n14177.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To shut up separately, to keep separate;</hi> orig. belonging to household lang.: <cit><quote lang="la">dispares disclusos habere pisces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:17:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 17, 4</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n14177.1" n="II" level="1"> With the notion of <hi rend="ital">dis</hi> predominant, <hi rend="ital">to keep apart, to separate, divide</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pares cum paribus jungi res, et discludere mundum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:438" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 438</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of the act of creation, imitated by Vergil: discludere Nerea ponto,</quote> <trans><tr>to separate, cut off</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paludibus mons erat ab reliquis disclusus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=43" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 43</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">mons Cevenna, qui Arvernos ab Helviis discludit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ossibus ac nervis disclusis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 171</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">turres (with disturbare domos),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:240" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 240</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus (sc. tignis) disclusis atque in contrariam partem revinctis,</quote> <trans><tr>kept asunder, kept at the proper distance apart</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:17:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 17, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut restis, ad ingluviem adstricta, spiritus officia discluderet,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>might prevent, choke off</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 109, 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14177.2" n="B" level="2"> Of abstr. objects: <cit><quote lang="la">Plato iram et cupiditatem locis disclusit: iram in pectore, cupiditatem subter praecordia locavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:10:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 10, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae semotae a mente et disclusae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 33, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morsus roboris,</quote> <trans><tr>to part, to open</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:782" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 782</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
disclusio: <entryFree id="n14178" type="hapax" key="disclu_si^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">disclūsĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>discludo</etym>, <sense id="n14178.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a separation</hi>: loci, App. de Deo Socr. <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
disclusus: <entryFree id="n14179" type="main" key="disclu_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">disclūsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from discludo.</entryFree>
disco: <entryFree id="n14180" type="main" key="disco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">disco</orth>, <itype>dĭdĭci, 3</itype> (<sense id="n14180.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">part. fut.</hi>: sic disciturum, etc., App. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 887</bibl> P.), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>from the root da-, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">dedaw/s, dah=nai</foreign>; dak-, cf. doceo, doctus, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">dida/skw</foreign></etym>, <hi rend="ital">to learn, to learn to know, to become acquainted with</hi>, etc. (for syn. cf.: capio, percipio, concipio, comprehendo, intellego, cognosco, nosco, agnosco, animadverto, calleo, scio—very freq. in all periods and sorts of writing). </sense><sense id="n14180.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">litteras Graecas senex didici,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 8, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:13:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 13, 29</bibl>: so, <cit><quote lang="la">litteras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus civile,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Mur. 9, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">10, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">litteras apud aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dialectica ab aliquo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 30, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artem ab aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:1:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 1, 10</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid de aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutem ex me, fortunam ex aliis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:435" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 435</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:8:6 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 8, 6 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fabularum similia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palaestram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:121" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">affectum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:11:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inde vocabula prima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1042" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1042</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">elementa prima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dulces querelas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1384" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1384</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">preces,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 133</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">me peritus Discet Iber,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:20:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 20, 20</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quem (Augustum) didicere Vindelici,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 14, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes crimine ab uno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 66</bibl></cit> et saep.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum est, unde jus civile discatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 45</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">jus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:3:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Crassus, quod disci potuit de jure didicit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:33:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 33, 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tot artibus discendis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:11:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 11, 9</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n14180.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> or <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pueri qui nare discunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rapere et clepere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:4:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 4, 5</bibl></cit> (ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 20, 15</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">Latine loqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 101:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 101, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobis ignoscere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:45" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">assem in partes diducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:326" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 326</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene ferre magnam fortunam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:27:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 27, 75</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">bene ubi quod consilium discimus accidisse, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 3, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">discit, Litavicum ad sollicitandos Haeduos profectum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animadverti et didici ex tuis litteris te omnibus in rebus habuisse rationem, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 30 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">deos didici securum agere aevum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 101</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n14180.3" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">relat. clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">plures discent, quemadmodum haec fiant, quam quemadmodum his resistatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:12:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 12, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum in Etruria belli esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patriae quid debeat, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:312" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 312</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n14180.4" n="(d)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">disces tu quidem a principe hujus aetatis philosophorum, et disces quamdiu voles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">didicit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>oratory</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:71:249" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 71, 249</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 14, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:12:14 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 12, 14 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">discendi aut visendi causa maria transmittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 3</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">discendi causa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:1:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> al.: <cit><quote lang="la">se ita a patribus majoribusque suis didicisse, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:13:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 13, 6</bibl></cit>. —Ellipt.: <cit><quote lang="la">discebant fidibus antiqui, sc. canere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">docere fidibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:22:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 22, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scire fidibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:5:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 5, 53</bibl></cit>).—</sense><sense id="n14180.5" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of inanimate subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 159</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec varios discet mentiri lana colores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:4:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 4, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:H. N. 16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> H. N. 16</bibl></cit> prooem.—</sense><sense id="n14180.6" n="c" level="4"> <cb n="DISC" /> <hi rend="ital">To teach</hi> = docere (late Lat., cf. <foreign lang="greek">manqa/nein</foreign>, and Eng. learn): <cit><quote lang="la">falsa discentes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
discobino: <entryFree id="n14181" type="main" key="disco^bi_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">discŏbīno</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>dis-scobina</etym>, <sense id="n14181.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to file away, to scratch, destroy by scratching</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">simulacra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
discobolus: <entryFree id="n14182" type="greek" key="disco^bo^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">discŏbŏlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">diskobo/los</foreign>, <sense id="n14182.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the thrower of the discus</hi> or <hi rend="ital">quoit</hi>, a famous piece of sculpture by Myron, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:13:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 13, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 57</bibl>; also by Naucydes, Plin. ib. § 80; <cit><quote lang="la">and a painting by Tauriscus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 11, 40, § 144</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
discoctus: <entryFree id="n14183" type="main" key="discoctus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">discoctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from discoquo.</entryFree>
discoides: <entryFree id="n14184" type="greek" key="disco^i_des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">discŏï_des</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">diskoeidh/s</foreign>, <sense id="n14184.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">quoit-shaped</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">figura,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 4, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
discolius: <entryFree id="n14185" type="greek" key="disco^li^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">discŏlĭus</orth> pes = <foreign lang="greek">diskolio/s</foreign>, <sense id="n14185.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a verse consisting of an iambus, pyrrhichius, and trochaeus</hi>, Atil. <bibl default="NO"><author>Fortun.</author> p. 2687</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
discolor: <entryFree id="n14186" type="main" key="disco^lor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-cŏlor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype> (<case>abl.</case> -ori, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:16:7" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 16, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:3:26" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 3, 26</bibl>—post-class. form of the <sense id="n14186.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fem.</hi> discolora, in the signif. of II. A.: lana, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 10, 302: <cit><quote lang="la">serta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Laud. in Val. 2:1" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Laud. in Val. 2, 1</bibl></cit> ed. Mai.: <cit><quote lang="la">venustas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 4 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and once discoloria vestis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 97, 3</bibl></cit>), <hi rend="ital">adj., of another color, not of the same color</hi> (opp. concolor). </sense><sense id="n14186.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n14186.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neutra pars esse debet discolor lanae (shortly before: si palatum atque lingua concolor lanae est),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:3:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(vestis) sumatur fatis discolor alba meis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:5:8" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aura auri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 204</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14186.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Absol., party-colored, of different colors</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">habere arculas, ubi discolores sint cerae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:17:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 17, 4</bibl></cit>: signa, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:chapter=13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: miles (<hi rend="ital">black and white</hi> in the game of draughts), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:477" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 477</bibl> Jahn; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">agmen (in running a race),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:2:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 2, 78</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14186.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n14186.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Party-colored, variegated</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 2, 2, § 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:4:26" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 4, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:2:5 al" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 2, 5 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n14186.6" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">of various kinds, different, various</hi>: matrona meretrici dispar erit atque Discolor, * <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnis pelago,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:338" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 338</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum discolor usus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:52" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 52</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
discolorius: <entryFree id="n14187" type="main" key="disco^lo_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">discŏlōrĭus</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">discŏlōrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n14187.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the preced.</ref></xr> art. <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
disconcinnus: <entryFree id="n14188" type="hapax" key="disconcinnus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-concinnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n14188.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., unsuitable, ill-matched</hi>: oculos (opp. concinnos), Fronto de Or. 2.</sense></entryFree>
disconduco: <entryFree id="n14189" type="hapax" key="discondu_co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-condūco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n14189.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., not to be profitable</hi> or <hi rend="ital">conducive, to be injurious, prejudicial</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nil disconducit huic rei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 85</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
disconvenientia: <entryFree id="n14190" type="main" key="disconve^ni^enti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-convĕnĭentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>disconvenio</etym>, <sense id="n14190.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">want of agreement, inconsistency</hi> (opp. convenientia), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Test. An. 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
disconvenio: <entryFree id="n14191" type="main" key="disconve^ni^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-convĕnĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <sense id="n14191.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to disagree; to be inharmonious, inconsistent</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">aestuat et vitae disconvenit ordine toto,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 99</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo disconvenit inter Meque et te,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 14, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">disconveniens deo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> de Ira D. 3, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
discooperio: <entryFree id="n14192" type="main" key="disco^o^pe^ri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-cŏŏpĕrĭo</orth>, <itype>pĕrui, pertum, 4</itype>, <sense id="n14192.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to uncover, disclose, lay bare, expose</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:21:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 21, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turpitudinem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 18, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verecundiora patris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:22:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ezech. 22, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14192.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to put off, take off, remove</hi> a covering: pallium, id. Ruth, 3, 4.—</sense><sense id="n14192.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to expose, disclose</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">peccata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Thren. 4, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
discophorus: <entryFree id="n14193" type="greek" key="disco^pho^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">discŏphŏrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">diskofo/ros</foreign>, <sense id="n14193.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who carries a dish</hi> (discus, II.), <hi rend="ital">a dishbearer</hi>, Hier. in Daniel, praef.</sense></entryFree>
discoquo: <entryFree id="n14194" type="main" key="disco^quo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-cŏquo</orth>, <itype>xi, ctum, 3</itype>, <sense id="n14194.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to boil to pieces, to boil thoroughly</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 25, 70, § 142</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:81" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 7, 26, § 81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:113" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 6, 60, § 113</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:24:5 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 24, 5 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
discordabilis: <entryFree id="n14195" type="hapax" key="discorda_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">discordābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>discordo</etym>, <sense id="n14195.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">disagreeing, discordant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenio haud discordabili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:3:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 3, 42</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
discordia: <entryFree id="n14196" type="main" key="discordi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">discordĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>discors</etym>, <sense id="n14196.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">disunion, disagreement, dissension, variance, discord</hi> (class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:4:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 4, 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:4:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 4, 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:9:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 9, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:7:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 7, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:25:85" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 25, 85</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:39:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 39, 83</bibl>;
