<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 5, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 24</bibl> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:545" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 7, 545</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:4:2" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 4, 60</bibl> et saep. —In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:7:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 7, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:25:86" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 25, 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:13:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 13, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:23:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 23, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:26" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 6, 19</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n14196.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n14196.2" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The subject of strife</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Idae et Phoebo discordia Eveni filia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:2:17" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 2, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14196.3" n="2" level="3"> Of inanimate things: <cit><quote lang="la">principiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:440" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 440</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:366" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 366</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ponti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:646" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 646</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incertae mentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:630" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 630</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n14196.4" n="II" level="1"> Personified: <cb n="DISC" /> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Discordia</orth>, <hi rend="ital">the goddess of discord</hi>, the Greek <hi rend="ital">Eris</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:280" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 280</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 702</bibl> Serv.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:74" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 74</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 124, 27 sq.</bibl>; Hyg. Fab. praef.—Hence, Discordiae malum, <hi rend="ital">the famous apple of Eris</hi> in the fable, <hi rend="ital">the apple of discord</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:15:11" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 15, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
discordialis: <entryFree id="n14197" type="spur" key="discordi^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">discordĭālis</orth>, false reading in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 54, § 142</bibl>, instead of discordiam, v. Sillig, ad h. l.</entryFree>
discordiosus: <entryFree id="n14198" type="main" key="discordi^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">discordĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>discordia</etym>, <sense id="n14198.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of discord, prone to discord</hi> (very rare; cf. discors and v. Krebs, Antibarb. p. 369): volgus seditiosum atque discordiosum, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 66:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 66, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 6, 2</bibl></cit>.— <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">discordĭōsē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in a spirit of discord</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Bapt. 3:15:20" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Bapt. 3, 15, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
discordis: <entryFree id="n14199" type="main" key="discordis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">discordis</orth>, is v. discors <sense id="n14199.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
discorditas: <entryFree id="n14200" type="hapax" key="discordi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">discordĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>discors</etym>, <sense id="n14200.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">disunion, discord</hi>, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 97, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
discordium: <entryFree id="n14201" type="main" key="discordi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">discordĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>discors</etym>, <sense id="n14201.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">discord, dissension.—Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">publica discordia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:1:57" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 1, 57</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
discordo: <entryFree id="n14202" type="main" key="discordo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">discordo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n14202.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be at variance, to differ, to quarrel</hi> (rare but class.). </sense><sense id="n14202.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">discordare inter se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:3:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 3, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupiditates in animis dissident atque discordant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:13:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 13, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus a se ipse dissidens secumque discordans,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 18, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Cheruscis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversus ventrem (membra),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 11, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14202.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to be unlike, out of harmony with; to disagree, be inconsistent with, opposed to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab oratione (vox),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 45</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 3, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">a se fortuna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:53:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 53, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avaro parcus (with hilaris nepoti discrepet),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 194</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">neu discordarent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eques,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 185</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
discoriatio: <entryFree id="n14203" type="main" key="disco^ri^a_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">discŏrĭātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>dis-corium</etym>, <sense id="n14203.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a flaying, removal of the skin</hi>, Soran. qu. Med. 245 (cf. discorio, <foreign lang="greek">a)pode/rw</foreign>, Gloss.).</sense></entryFree>
discors: <entryFree id="n14204" type="main" key="discors"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-cors</orth>, <itype>cordis</itype> (<sense id="n14204.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nom. f.</hi> discordis, Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 726</bibl> Com., v. 164 Rib.), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cor</etym>, <hi rend="ital">discordant, disagreeing, inharmonious, at variance;</hi> opp. concors (class.). </sense><sense id="n14204.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. </sense><sense id="n14204.2" n="A" level="2"> Of persons: homines non contentione, non ambitione discordes, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:33:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 33, 91</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad alia discordes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in civitate discordi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vexillarii discordium legionum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 38</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tanais discors,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 29, 28</bibl></cit> et saep.; <cit><quote lang="la">of Minotaurus: fetus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitas secum ipsa discors,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">filius (Tigranis) discors patri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:37:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 37, 2</bibl></cit>; so with <case>dat.</case>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 42</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 38</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14204.3" n="B" level="2"> Of inanimate things: <cit><quote lang="la">inter se discordia membra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:894" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 894</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">semina rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:356" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 356</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:621" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 621</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:459" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 459</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:3:37" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 3, 37</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">bella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:403" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 403</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:688" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 688</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vesania,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 174</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concordia rerum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 12, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">symphonia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:374" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 374</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14204.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n14204.5" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">unlike, discordant, different</hi> (post-Aug): <cit><quote lang="la">hostes moribus et linguis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:13:4" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 13, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">linguae tot populorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 6, § 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aestus marini tempore,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>taking place at different times</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:218" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 97, 99, § 218</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mixtura generum in vino, non modo in musto discors,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 22, 35, § 187</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14204.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Different, distinct, double</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">a fonte discors manat hinc uno latex,</quote> <trans><tr>two distinct streams</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 711" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 711</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se scindit unius sacri Discors favilla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oed. 322" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Oed. 322</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">discordemque utero fetum tulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 133</bibl></cit> (Merk. al. dissortem).—<hi rend="ital">Comp., sup.</hi>, and <pos>adv.</pos> do not occur.</sense></entryFree>
discrebilis: <entryFree id="n14205" type="hapax" key="discre_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">discrēbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>discerno</etym>, <sense id="n14205.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that can be discerned, discernible</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Res Gest. Alex. M. 3:42" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Res Gest. Alex. M. 3, 42</bibl></cit> Mai.</sense></entryFree>
discredo: <entryFree id="n14206" type="main" key="discre_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-crēdo</orth>, <itype>dĭdi, dĭtum, 3</itype>, <sense id="n14206.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to be incredulous towards, not to believe</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Res Gest. Alex. M. 3:58" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Res Gest. Alex. M. 3, 58</bibl> Mai.; Commod. praef. 3, al.</sense></entryFree>
discrepabilis: <entryFree id="n14207" type="main" key="discre^pa_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">discrĕpābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>discrepo</etym>, <sense id="n14207.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">irreconcilable, discrepant</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> in Psa. 100, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
discrepans: <entryFree id="n14208" type="main" key="discre^pans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">discrĕpans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from discrepo.</entryFree>
discrepantia: <entryFree id="n14209" type="main" key="discre^panti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">discrĕpantĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>discrepo</etym>, <sense id="n14209.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">discordance, dissimilarity, discrepancy</hi> (a Ciceron. word): <cit><quote lang="la">rerum et verborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scripti et voluntatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:chapter=25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 25 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:31:111" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 31, 111</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
discrepatio: <entryFree id="n14210" type="main" key="discre^pa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">discrĕpātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n14210.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a discrepancy, dispute</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter consules fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:18:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 18, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. Drak. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:31:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 31, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
discrepito: <entryFree id="n14211" type="main" key="discre^pi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">discrĕpĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n14211.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq. n.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">to</hi> <pb n="589" /> <cb n="DISC" /> <hi rend="ital">disagree wholly, to be altogether different</hi> (a Lucretian word): <cit><quote lang="la">res longe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1105</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1018" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 1018</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter se (with disjunctum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:803" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 803</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
discrepo: <entryFree id="n14212" type="main" key="discre^po"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-crĕpo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, 1</itype>, <sense id="n14212.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to differ in sound, to sound differently, discordantly, not to harmonize</hi> (for syn. cf.: differo, disto, intersum). </sense><sense id="n14212.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (rare; <cit><quote lang="la">perh. only in Cic.): ut in fidibus aut tibiis, quamvis paulum discrepent, tamen id a sciente animadverti solet: sic videndum est in vita, ne forte quid discrepet, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 40 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:42:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 42, 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:50:196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 50, 196</bibl>.—Far more freq., </sense><sense id="n14212.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to disagree, be different, to vary, differ</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">peccata, quia discrepant, aeque discrepant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:27:75" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 27, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio verbis discrepans, sententiis congruens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tres duces discrepantes, prope ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 41</bibl></cit>: nec multum discrepat aetas, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:434" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 434</bibl> et saep.: eadem dicit; <cit><quote lang="la">nulla in re discrepat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de ceteris rebus discrepantium philosophorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:28:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 28, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbo inter se discrepare, re unum sonare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:21:83" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 21, 83</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:49:144" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 49, 144</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">discrepare ab aequitate sapientiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 9</bibl></cit>; so with <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:40:145" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 40, 145</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:30:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 30, 118</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:17:42 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 17, 42 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">facta ejus cum dictis discrepare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 30</bibl></cit>; so with <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=102" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 102</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsi sibi singuli discrepantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:de Or. 3:50:196" default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 50, 196</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:Tusc. 4:13:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 13, 29</bibl>; so with <case>dat.</case>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:27:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 27, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 6, 92</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 194</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 152</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:6:18 al" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 6, 18 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n14212.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: res discrepat, and more freq. <hi rend="ital">impers.</hi> discrepat, <hi rend="ital">there is a difference of opinion</hi> respecting something (esp. a fact), <hi rend="ital">it is a matter of dispute, it is undecided</hi> (opp. convenit): <cit><quote lang="la">incidi in rem multum discrepantem auctorum opinionibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:7:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 7, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">causa latendi discrepat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:572" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 572</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum de legibus conveniret, de latore tantum discreparet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 31 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: veneno quidem occisum, convenit; <cit><quote lang="la">ubi autem discrepat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:44" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 44</bibl></cit>; so with <hi rend="ital">rel. clause</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:25:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 25, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">id, quod haud discrepat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 46</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec discrepat, quin dictator eo anno A. Cornelius fuerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 40</bibl></cit>; so with <hi rend="ital">quin</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:28:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 28, 3</bibl>; cf. Weissenb. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 1, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter scriptores rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 38, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter auctores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 61</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:25" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
discresco: <entryFree id="n14213" type="hapax" key="discresco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-cresco</orth>, <itype>crēvi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n14213.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to grow broad, grow out</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> de Mort. Pers. 33, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
discretim: <entryFree id="n14214" type="main" key="discre_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">discrētim</orth>, <sense id="n14214.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adv., separately</hi>, v. discerno <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
discretio: <entryFree id="n14215" type="main" key="discre_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">discrētĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>discerno</etym> (postclass.). <sense id="n14215.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A separation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum vis aliqua utrumque (corpus et animam) discreverit, quae discretio mors vocetur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 6, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 7, 12, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14215.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A difference, distinction</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine discretione,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Jul. 4, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 17, 1 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n14215.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Discernment, discrimination, capacity for distinguishing</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">ne, propter discretionem difficilem, jus incertum sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,007:12:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Cor. 12, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">boni ac mali,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Hebr. 5, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
discretivus: <entryFree id="n14216" type="main" key="discre_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">discrētīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n14216.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">serving to distinguish</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1021</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1061 al.</bibl> P.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">discrētīvē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">by way of distinction</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Donat.</author> ad Ter. Eun. 1, 2, 43</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
discretor: <entryFree id="n14217" type="main" key="discre_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">discrētor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n14217.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he who discerns</hi> or <hi rend="ital">judges, a discerner</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cogitationum deus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Hebr. 4, 12 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
discretus: <entryFree id="n14218" type="main" key="discre_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">discrētus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from discerno.</entryFree>
discretorium: <entryFree id="n14219" type="main" key="discre_to_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">discrētōrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">dia/fragma</foreign>, <sense id="n14219.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the diaphragm</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:12:143" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 12, 143</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
discribo: <entryFree id="n14220" type="main" key="di_scri_bo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dī-scrībo</orth>, <itype>scripsi, scriptum, 3</itype>, <sense id="n14220.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to distribute, divide</hi> among several persons, <hi rend="ital">apportion, assign</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(class.) quodne (argentum) ego discripsi porro illis quibus debui?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:8:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 8, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum ipsorum bona, quantacumque erant, statim suis comitibus compotoribusque discripsit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 8, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbis partīs ad incendia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duodena jugera in singulos homines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:31:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 31, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populum in tribus tres, curiasque triginta, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitatibus jura,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">negotii publici curatio discripta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:30:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 30, 66</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">judicantem vidimus Aeacum sedesque discriptas deorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:13:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 13, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">militibus voluntariis in legiones discriptis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 14, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:34:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 34, 8</bibl> Weissenb. ad loc.; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:42:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 42, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:56:6" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 56, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:26:6 al" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 26, 6 al.</bibl> (v. describo, II. B. 2., and cf. Bücheler, in Rhein-Mus. 13, 598 sq.). <cb n="DISC" /></sense></entryFree>
discrimen: <entryFree id="n14221" type="main" key="discri_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">discrīmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>contr. from discerimen à discerno; cf. crimen from cerno</etym>, lit., <sense id="n14221.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that which separates</hi> or <hi rend="ital">divides</hi> two things from each other (for syn. cf.: differentia, discrepantia, diversitas, distantia); hence, </sense><sense id="n14221.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an intervening space, interval, distance, division, separation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum (duo maria) pertenui discrimine separarentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:32:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 32, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minimum quos inter et hostem Discrimen murus clausaque porta facit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Pont. 1, 8, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequo discrimine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:690" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 690</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 154</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">parvum leti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:426" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 426</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 143</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dare discrimina costis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to separate them</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 382</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (sc. littera F) inter discrimina dentium efflanda est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agminum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:12" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ungulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:15" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:302" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 302</bibl></cit>; and in like manner <usg type="style">poet.</usg>: telluris pectitae, i. e. <hi rend="ital">furrow</hi>, Col. Poët. 10, 94; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Nupt. Honor. 103</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">medium luci,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyneg. 486</bibl></cit>.—Hence, med. t. t., the dividing membrane, <hi rend="ital">the midriff, diaphragm</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:11:127" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 11, 127</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:5:10:124 al" default="NO">5, 10, 124 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n14221.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (so most frequent). </sense><sense id="n14221.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a distinction, difference</hi>: amabat omnes, nam discrimen non facit, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 282, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">iste, qui omnia jura pretio exaequasset omniumque rerum delectum atque discrimen pecunia sustulisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 50</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">officia tollebantur delectu omni et discrimine remoto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:25:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 25, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sit hoc discrimen inter gratiosos cives atque fortes, ut illi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:chapter=21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine ullo sexus discrimine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">rapti per agros viatores sine discrimine liberi servique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omisso sui alicuique discrimine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divinarum humanarumque rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recti pravique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:3:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 5, 25</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">so of the different tones of the strings: septem discrimina vocum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:646" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 646</bibl></cit> et saep.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenues parvi discriminis umbrae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of easy gradation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 62</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n14221.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n14221.5" n="1" level="3"> With respect to disputed matters, which are to be distinguished between, and thus decided upon, <hi rend="ital">the decisive point, turning-point, critical moment, determination, decision</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam res in id discrimen adducta est, utrum ille poenas rei publicae luat, an nos serviamus,</quote> <trans><tr>to this point</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:11:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 11, 29</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ea res nunc in discrimine versatur, utrum ... an, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 30, 92</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vicit disciplina militaris, vicit imperii majestas, quae in discrimine fuerunt, an ulla post hanc diem essent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:35:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 35, 4</bibl></cit>: haec et his similia haud in magno equidem ponam discrimine, <hi rend="ital">shall not regard as of great moment</hi>, id. praef. § <cit><quote lang="la">8: postquam adesse discrimen ultimum belli animadvertit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">instant enim (adversarii) et saepe discrimen omne committunt,</quote> <trans><tr>abandon the most decisive points</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:4:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 4, 17</bibl></cit> et saep.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">experiar, deus hic, discrimine aperto, An sit mortalis,</quote> <trans><tr>the test</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:222" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 222</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14221.6" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a dangerous, decisive moment, crisis, dangerous condition; risk, danger, hazard</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ipso discrimine periculi aliquem destituere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 17</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">periculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 24</bibl></cit>: in summo rem esse discrimine, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:38:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 38, 2</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">adducta est res in maximum periculum et extremum pene discrimen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salus sociorum summum in periculum ac discrimen vocatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in extremo discrimine ac dimicatione fortunae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:chapter=28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in veteris fortunae discrimen adducitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:27:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 27, 55</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in discrimen capitis adducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 1, 2</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">capitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:49" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ei subito sit allatum periculum discrimenque patriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:43:154" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 43, 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem publicam in discrimen committere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:7" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 7</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fuitque dies illa tenebrarum et discriminis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,019:11:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Esth. 11, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
discriminalis: <entryFree id="n14222" type="main" key="discri_mi^na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">discrīmĭnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>discrimino</etym>, <sense id="n14222.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that serves to divide</hi> or <hi rend="ital">part</hi> (late Lat.): acus, <hi rend="ital">a pin</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bodkin that parts the hair, a hair-pin</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ruf. 3, 42</bibl>.—Also, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">discrīmĭnāle</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a head-dress</hi>, Vulg. lsa. 3, 20.</sense></entryFree>
discriminatim: <entryFree id="n14223" type="main" key="discri_mi^na_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">discrīmĭnātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n14223.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">with a difference</hi> or <hi rend="ital">distinction</hi> (very rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:7:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 7, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
discriminatio: <entryFree id="n14224" type="main" key="discri_mi^na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">discrīmĭnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, rhet. t. t., = <foreign lang="greek">paradiastolh/</foreign>, <sense id="n14224.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the contrasting of opposite thoughts</hi>, Rufin. Schem. lex. § 20.</sense></entryFree>
discriminator: <entryFree id="n14225" type="main" key="discri_mi^na_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">discrīmĭnātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n14225.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who</hi> <cb n="DISC" /> <hi rend="ital">distinguishes</hi> or <hi rend="ital">discriminates</hi> (late Lat) = distinctor, Aug. ap. Joann. 20, 12.</sense></entryFree>
discriminatrix: <entryFree id="n14226" type="main" key="discri_mi^na_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">discrīmĭnātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>discriminator</etym>, <sense id="n14226.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she who distinguishes</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">fandi ac nefandi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Nazar.</author> Pan. ad Const. 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
discrimino: <entryFree id="n14227" type="main" key="discri_mi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">discrīmĭno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>discrimen</etym>, <sense id="n14227.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to divide, part, separate</hi> (very rare; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">divido, dispertio): aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:23:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 23, 4</bibl></cit>: Etruriam discriminat Cassia, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 12, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">late agros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,026:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jud. 10, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14227.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to distinguish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">notae, quibus inter se similia discriminentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 95" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 95 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=104" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 104</bibl></cit> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n14227.2" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To divide, apportion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vigiliarum somnique tempora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 4, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
discriminosius: <entryFree id="n14228" type="main" key="discri_mi^no_si^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">discrīmĭnōsĭus</orth>, <sense id="n14228.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adv. comp.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">more decisively</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Res Gest. Alex. 2:24" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Res Gest. Alex. 2, 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
discriptio: <entryFree id="n14229" type="main" key="di_scriptio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīscriptio</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>discribo</etym>, <sense id="n14229.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a division, distribution, apportionment</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:65:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 65, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:18:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 18, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">privatarum possessionum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:7:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 7, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 24, 68</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:46:70" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 46, 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:33:92 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 33, 92 al.</bibl> (In these passages, formerly descriptio, q. v.)</sense></entryFree>
discruciatus: <entryFree id="n14230" type="main" key="discru^ci^a_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">discrŭcĭātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from discrucio.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n14231" type="main" key="discru^ci^a_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">discrŭcĭātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n14231.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">violent torture, torment</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Ham. 836</bibl>. From</sense></entryFree>
discrucio: <entryFree id="n14232" type="main" key="discru^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-crŭcĭo</orth>, no <sense id="n14232.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, ātum, 1, <hi rend="ital">v. a., to torture violently, to torment</hi> (repeatedly in Plaut. and Cic.; elsewh. rare). </sense><sense id="n14232.1" n="I" level="1"> Physically: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem discruciatum necare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:18:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 18, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 27, 12, 3</bibl>.—More freq., </sense><sense id="n14232.2" n="II" level="1"> Mentally, with <hi rend="ital">se</hi> or in the mid. form, <hi rend="ital">to torment one's self; to be troubled, vexed, chagrined</hi>: quid te discrucias? Plaut. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 143, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego discrucior miser amore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:3:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 3, 58</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 155</bibl>.—With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:66:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 66, 76</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod enim ipse celeriter arripuit, id cum tarde percipi videt, discruciatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:11:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 11, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">discrucior animi, quia, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:1:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 1, 2, 27</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 4, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
discubitio: <entryFree id="n14233" type="gloss" key="discu^bi^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">discŭbĭtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>discumbo</etym>, <sense id="n14233.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place for lying down, a couch</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2106</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
discubitus: <entryFree id="n14234" type="main" key="discu^bi^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">discŭbĭtus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n14234.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a reclining at table</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:1:9" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 1, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14234.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a place at table</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amare primos discubitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:20:46 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 20, 46 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
disculcio: <entryFree id="n14235" type="main" key="disculci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-culcĭo</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>calceo</etym>, <sense id="n14235.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to unshoe, remove the shoe from</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> 374</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
discumbo: <entryFree id="n14236" type="main" key="discumbo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-cumbo</orth>, <itype>cŭbŭi, cŭbĭtum, 3</itype>, <sense id="n14236.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to lie down</hi>. </sense><sense id="n14236.1" n="I" level="1"> More freq., <hi rend="ital">to recline at table</hi> for the purpose of eating (cf. accumbo—so esp. freq. since the Aug. per.): <cit><quote lang="la">discubuimus omnes praeter illam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 1, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:912" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 912</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:48" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:5:95" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 5, 95</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:708" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 708</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:566" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 566</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Johan. 12, 2 al.</bibl>—Sometimes of a single person (yet always with the accessory idea of a number reclining at the same time): <cit><quote lang="la">in convivio Germanici cum super eum Piso discumberet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:74" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:5:6" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 5, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:12" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 12</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">discumbitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:700" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 700</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:19 al" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 19 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n14236.2" n="II" level="1"> Rarely, <hi rend="ital">to lie down to sleep</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">discubitum noctu ire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:1:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 1, 1, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cenati discubuerunt ibidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:4:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 4, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
discuneatus: <entryFree id="n14237" type="hapax" key="discu^ne^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-cŭnĕātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n14237.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., wedged apart, kept asunder as by a wedge</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">conchae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 30, 48, § 90</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
discupio: <entryFree id="n14238" type="main" key="discu^pi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-cŭpĭo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> (in famil. lang. for vehementer cupio), <sense id="n14238.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to desire greatly, to long for</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">discupio dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 87</bibl></cit>: te videre, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 15, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">se vendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:106:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 106, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
discurro: <entryFree id="n14239" type="main" key="discurro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-curro</orth>, <itype>curri and cucurri</itype> (<sense id="n14239.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> discucurri, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:25:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 25, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 4:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:32" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">discurrisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:15:5" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 15, 5</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">oftener curri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:7:32" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 7, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 90:36" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 90, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:15:10 al" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 15, 10 al.</bibl>), <itype>cursum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> </sense><sense id="n14239.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To run different ways, to run to and fro, run about</hi> (not freq. till after the Aug. per.; in Cic not at all): in muris armata civitas, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:105:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 105, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">deus in montibus altis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:285" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 285</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plebs pileata tota Urbe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:57" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circa deum delubra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">circa vias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per omnes silvas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:419" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 419</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">per ambitum lacus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 21</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">per Baianum sinum equis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">more victorum cum palma discucurrit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 32</bibl></cit> et saep.—Designating<pb n="590" /> <cb n="DISC" />  the <hi rend="ital">term. ad quem</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad portas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:577" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 577</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad praedam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:15" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad officia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad rapiendas virgines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 9</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">in latera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 2:3:10" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 2, 3, 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">a media in utramque partem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 15</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ilicet in muros tota discurritur urbe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:468" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 468</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in tribus ad suffragium ferendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab caede ad diripiendam urbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:16 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 16 al.</bibl></cit>— <cit><quote lang="la">In the pass., with a homogeneous subject: discursis magnis itineribus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 29, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14239.2" n="B" level="2"> Of inanimate and abstract subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">discurrentes maculae in gemma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 1, 3, § 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:117" default="NO" valid="yes">13, 21, 37, § 117</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">catenae circa latera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:40 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 3, 12, § 40 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Nilus) diversa ruens septem discurrit in ora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:291" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 291</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 69, § 182</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fama tota urbe discurrit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:1" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mens discurret utroque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 443</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14239.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to traverse, run through</hi> or <hi rend="ital">over, hasten through</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">latius arva,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Descr. Orb. 516</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gallias,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tramite aliquo discurso,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 16, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">discursis itineribus magnis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 29, 5, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14239.4" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, like Gr. <foreign lang="greek">dielqei=n</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">to speak at length</hi> of a thing, <hi rend="ital">to discourse of</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">super quo nunc pauca discurram,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 17, 4</bibl></cit> (cf. in this sense the Romance <hi rend="ital">discorrere, discourir</hi>, and v. 2, discursus, II.).</sense></entryFree>
discursatio: <entryFree id="n14240" type="main" key="discursa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">discursātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>discurso</etym>, <sense id="n14240.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a running hither and thither, a running about</hi> (post-Aug. and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">officiosa per urbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Brev. Vit. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 1:5" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 1, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animalium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Opif. D. 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
discursator: <entryFree id="n14241" type="main" key="discursa_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">discursātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n14241.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who runs hither and thither, one who runs about</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">pedites et leves,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 12, 21</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">hostis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 29, 5, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">14, 2, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
discursim: <entryFree id="n14242" type="main" key="discursim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">discursim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>discurro</etym>, <sense id="n14242.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">by running</hi> or <hi rend="ital">going about</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 1, 1</bibl> (dub.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Res Gest. Alex. 1:51" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Res Gest. Alex. 1, 51</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
discursio: <entryFree id="n14243" type="main" key="discursi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">discursĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n14243.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a running different ways, scattering</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">discursiones predatoriae,</quote> <trans><tr>scattered raids for plunder, foragings</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 4, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14243.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A hasty passing through</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">discursione rapidā maturabant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 31, 9, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
discurso: <entryFree id="n14244" type="main" key="discurso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">discurso</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n14244.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr., to run about, hasten up and down</hi> (post - Aug. and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">multum in agendo discursantem, salientem, etc.... non agere dixit (Domitius Afer) sed satagere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:54" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 54</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:126" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 126</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:18:10" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 18, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14244.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act., to traverse</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">Gallias,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 5, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
discursor: <entryFree id="n14245" type="main" key="discursor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">discursor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n14245.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who runs about</hi>, (Pseud.) Augustin. ad Frat. Erem. Serm. 5.</sense></entryFree>
discursus: <entryFree id="n14246" type="main" key="discursus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">discursus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from discurro.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n14247" type="main" key="discursus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">discursus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>discurro</etym>. <sense id="n14247.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A running to and fro, a running about</hi> (mostly post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">magno clamore discursuque passim fugae se mandant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:29:2" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 29, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:12:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 12, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 9, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:223" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 223</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:86" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:428 al" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 428 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n14247.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n14247.2" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A pace, gait</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">acri discursu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 7, 16</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n14247.3" n="2" level="3"> Of inanimate things: <cit><quote lang="la">radicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 20, 33, § 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 12, 29, § 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">macularum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 15, 26, § 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">telorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:1:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14247.4" n="II" level="1"> In late Lat. (acc. to discurro, III.), <hi rend="ital">a conversation, discourse</hi>: redempti, Cod. Th. 9, 24, 1 (cf. It. <hi rend="ital">discorso</hi>, Fr. <hi rend="ital">discours</hi>).</sense></entryFree>
discus: <entryFree id="n14248" type="greek" key="discus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">discus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">di/skos</foreign>. <sense id="n14248.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A quoit</hi>, an implement for exercise in ancient gymnastics, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:646 sq" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 646 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:14:10" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 14, 10</bibl> (4, 13, 10 M.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 8, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 2, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:380" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 380</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:177 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 177 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n14248.1" n="b" level="4"> Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui discum audire quam philosophum malunt,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>who prefer trifles to serious things</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:5:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 5, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14248.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A dish</hi>, so called because shaped like a quoit, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 125</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:14:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 14, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14248.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The disc of a dial, a sundial</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 9, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n14249" type="main" key="Discus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Discus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n14249.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a freedman</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 60</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
discusse: <entryFree id="n14250" type="main" key="discusse_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">discussē</orth>, <sense id="n14250.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adv., minutely, accurately</hi>, etc., v. discutio <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
discussio: <entryFree id="n14251" type="main" key="discussi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">discussĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>discutio</etym> (very rare). <sense id="n14251.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A shaking</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 6:19:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 6, 19, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14251.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An examination, discussion</hi>. </sense><sense id="n14251.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (late Lat. for disputatio, quaestio): <cit><quote lang="la">sequitur illa discussio, quid sit, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 16, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pudic. 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14251.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., in the later period of the empire, <hi rend="ital">a revision<cb n="DISG" />  of the public accounts</hi> in the provinces, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 10, 30, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 5:74" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 5, 74</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
discussor: <entryFree id="n14252" type="main" key="discussor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">discussor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n14252.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an examiner</hi> (late Lat.). </sense><sense id="n14252.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 21, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14252.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., in the later period of the empire, <hi rend="ital">one who revised the accounts of the public revenue</hi> in the provinces, <hi rend="ital">an auditor</hi>, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">logoqe/ths</foreign>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 10</bibl>, tit. 30; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 5:76 al" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 5, 76 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
discussorius: <entryFree id="n14253" type="hapax" key="discusso_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">discussōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n14253.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">discutient, dissolving</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 8, 22, § 75</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
discussus: <entryFree id="n14254" type="main" key="discussus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">discussus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from discutio.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n14255" type="main" key="discussus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">discussus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>discutio</etym>, <sense id="n14255.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dashing, agitating</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(lupus) si haesit in hamo, tumultuoso discussu laxat volnera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 2, 5, § 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
discutio: <entryFree id="n14256" type="main" key="discu^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-cŭtĭo</orth>, <itype>cussi, cussum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>quatio</etym>, <sense id="n14256.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to strike asunder, dash to pieces, shatter</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n14256.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: dentes, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 455, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">deum delubra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:418" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 418</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">columna rostrata tota ad imum fulmine discussa est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne saxa ex catapultis lateritium discuterent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 9, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquantum muri tribus arietibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 12</bibl></cit>: rostro (navis) discusso, <hi rend="ital">shattered</hi>, Auct. B. Alex. 46, 2; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tempora cava ictu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:625" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 625</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ora saxo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:519" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 519</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">percussam aquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 8, 29, § 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nubes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">discussae jubae capiti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:810" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 810</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n14256.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n14256.3" n="A" level="2"> In medic. lang., <hi rend="ital">to scatter, disperse</hi> ( = digerere), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 43" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 15, 47, § 135</bibl> et saep. —</sense><sense id="n14256.4" n="B" level="2"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">to break up, scatter, disperse, dissipate</hi>. </sense><sense id="n14256.5" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (rarely): <cit><quote lang="la">illos coetus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 28</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Boeoticum consilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sole orto est discussa (caligo),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caligo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 12, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">umbras (sol),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:357" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 357</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:669" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 12, 669</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">discussa nox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:700" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 700</bibl></cit>.—Rarely with pers. objects: <cit><quote lang="la">Cato discutit Etruscos, Gabinius Marsos, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>routs, subdues</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:18:13" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 18, 13</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hostiles turmae discussae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 25, 1</bibl></cit>.—Far more freq. and class., </sense><sense id="n14256.6" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrorem animi tenebrasque,</quote> <trans><tr>to disperse, dispel</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 148</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:61 al" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 61 al.</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 57</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod rem totam discusseram,</quote> <trans><tr>had frustrated, brought to naught</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 12</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so freq.: rem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 56</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:10" default="NO" valid="yes">39, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:2 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 2 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">discutere et comprimere periculum consilio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:39:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 39, 84</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">periculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 2:11:4" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 2, 11, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">captiones (shortly before: dissolvere interrogationes),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 15, 46</bibl></cit>: omnem ejus cunctationem, Asin. Pollio ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:33:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 33, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">disceptationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crimen alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">famam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilia hostium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 4:7:31" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 4, 7, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seditionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:ib. 1:9:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 9, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:81" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 81</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum (with sepelire),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:75" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nefas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:18:9" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 18, 9</bibl></cit> et saep. —Hence, * <orth extent="full" lang="la">discussē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, only <hi rend="ital">comp., minutely, accurately</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">explorare discussius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 891</bibl></cit>.!*? For the meaning to investigate, discuss (lit., to separate mentally, distinguish, as in disputare, discernere, etc.), which prevails in the post-class. derivatives: discussio, discussor, and discusse; as also in the Romance: discutere, discussare, discussione; discuter, discussion, etc., there appear to be no examples in the literary language.</sense></entryFree>
disdiapason: <entryFree id="n14257" type="greek" key="disdi^a^pa_so_n"><orth extent="full" lang="la">disdĭăpāsōn</orth>, <itype>indecl.</itype>, = <foreign lang="greek">di\s dia\ pasw=n</foreign>, <sense id="n14257.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a double octave</hi> in music, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 950</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:4:9 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 4, 9 al.</bibl>; cf. diapason.</sense></entryFree>
