disemus: <entryFree id="n14258" type="greek" key="di^se_mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭsēmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">di/shmos</foreign>, <sense id="n14258.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dissyllabic</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 978</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">§ 981</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
diserte: <entryFree id="n14259" type="main" key="di^serte_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭsertē</orth>, <sense id="n14259.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adv., clearly</hi>, etc., v. dissero, <hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi> </sense><sense id="n14259.1" n="(a)" level="5">.</sense></entryFree>
disertim: <entryFree id="n14260" type="main" key="di^sertim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭsertim</orth>, <sense id="n14260.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adv., clearly, expressly</hi>, etc., v. dissero, <hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi> </sense><sense id="n14260.1" n="(b)" level="5">.</sense></entryFree>
disertiones: <entryFree id="n14261" type="gloss" key="di^serti^o_nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭsertĭōnes</orth> <itype>divisiones patrimoniorum inter consortes</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=72:8" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 72, 8</bibl>; cf. Müll. ad h. l.</entryFree>
disertitudo: <entryFree id="n14262" type="main" key="di^serti^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭsertĭtūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>disertus</etym>, <sense id="n14262.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">eloquence</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 50</bibl>, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> 5; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:33:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 33, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
disertus: <entryFree id="n14263" type="main" key="di^sertus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭsertus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. <itype>dissero</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos></entryFree>
disglutino: <entryFree id="n14264" type="main" key="disglu_ti^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-glūtĭno</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n14264.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to disjoin, disunite</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">conjuncta (with dissuere),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 66</bibl></cit>, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> 12.</sense></entryFree>
disgrego: <entryFree id="n14265" type="main" key="disgre^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-grĕgo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n14265.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to separate, divide</hi> (opp. congrego; <cit><quote lang="la">late Lat.),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 3, § 289</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">9, § 913</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
disgregus: <entryFree id="n14266" type="hapax" key="disgre^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">disgrĕgus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>disgrego</etym>, <cb n="DISJ" /> <sense id="n14266.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">different, unlike</hi> (with dispar), <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 892</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dishiasco: <entryFree id="n14267" type="hapax" key="dishi^asco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-hĭasco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n14267.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to gape open, to chink, chap</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:12" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
disicio: <entryFree id="n14268" type="main" key="di_si^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīs-ĭcĭo</orth> (or <orth extent="full" lang="la">dissĭcio</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:639" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 639</bibl>; less correctly, <orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-jĭcio</orth>), <itype>jēci, jectum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>jacio</etym>, <sense id="n14268.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to throw asunder; to drive asunder; to scatter, disperse</hi> (freq. in poets and historians, esp. since the Aug. per.; not in Cic., Plaut., or Ter.). </sense><sense id="n14268.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">partibus disjectis disque supatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:651" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 651</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:1020" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 1020</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">materies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:939" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 939</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis animaï (with dispertita and discissa),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:639" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 639</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:400" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 400</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in vasta urbe lateque omnibus disjectis moenibus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>distributed, stretching out in various directions</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 33 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">disjecta nube,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 49, 50, § 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nubes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 179</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nubila,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:328" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 328</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">membra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:724" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 724</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora ponto (with age diversos),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rates,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 43</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">naves passim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves in aperta Oceani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 23</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">frontem mediam mentumque securi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:308" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 308</bibl></cit>; cf.: scyphus in duas partes disjectus, Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:14:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 14, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">crinem disjecta Venus,</quote> <trans><tr>with dishevelled hair</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:203" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 203</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of money,</quote> <trans><tr>to squander</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:5:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 5, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14268.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n14268.3" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="dom">Milit. t. t.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to disperse, scatter, rout</hi> the enemy: <cit><quote lang="la">ea (phalange) disjecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:25:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 25, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 41</bibl>; Pompeius ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 12</bibl> B.: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 61:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 61, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 50:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 50, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:2 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 2 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostium disjecta frangere,</quote> <trans><tr>the scattered enemy</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 29, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14268.4" n="B" level="2"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">to dash to pieces, lay in ruins, destroy; to frustrate, thwart, bring to naught</hi>. </sense><sense id="n14268.5" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcem a fundamentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,020:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Timol. 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moenia urbium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:ib" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> § 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 109</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:75" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sepulchra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 81</bibl></cit> al.: <cit><quote lang="la">globum consensionis,</quote> <trans><tr>to dissolve</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 8, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniam,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to squander</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:5:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 5, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: dide, disice, per me licet, Caecil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:16:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 16, 37</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14268.6" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (i. q. discutere, II. B. 2.): <cit><quote lang="la">dissice compositam pacem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:339" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 339</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">pacem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:295" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 295</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilia ducis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cogitationem regiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:10" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exspectationem novarum tabularum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:42" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 42</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
disjecto: <entryFree id="n14269" type="main" key="disjecto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">disjecto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>disicio</etym>, <sense id="n14269.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to hurl hither and thither, to scatter, disperse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">disjectare solet magnum mare transtra, cavernas, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:553" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 553</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:ib. 562" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 562</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">3, 501: conspiratas gentes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 19, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
disjectus: <entryFree id="n14270" type="main" key="disjectus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">disjectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from disicio.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n14271" type="hapax" key="disjectus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">disjectus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>disicio</etym>, <sense id="n14271.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a casting asunder, scattering</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:928" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 928</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
disjicio: <entryFree id="n14272" type="main" key="disjicio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-jicio</orth>, v. disicio.</entryFree>
disjugatio: <entryFree id="n14273" type="main" key="disju^ga_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">disjŭgātĭo</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">disjŭgo</orth>, v. dijug.</entryFree>
disjuncte: <entryFree id="n14274" type="main" key="disjuncte_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">disjunctē</orth>, <sense id="n14274.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adv., separately, distinctly</hi>, etc., v. disjungo, <hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi> a.</sense></entryFree>
disjunctim: <entryFree id="n14275" type="main" key="disjunctim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">disjunctim</orth>, <sense id="n14275.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adv., separately</hi>, etc., v. disjungo, <hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi> b.</sense></entryFree>
disjunctio: <entryFree id="n14276" type="main" key="disjuncti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">disjunctĭo</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">dījunctio</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>disjungo</etym>, <sense id="n14276.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a separation</hi> (a Ciceron. word). </sense><sense id="n14276.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">in tanta disjunctione meorum, tanta acerbitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:21:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 21, 47</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">(amicorum), with alienatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:chapter=21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animorum disjunctio dissensionem facit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the diversity, difference</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 6, 14</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">sententiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:17:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 17, 40</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14276.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n14276.3" n="A" level="2"> In philos. lang., <hi rend="ital">an opposition of two propositions disjunctively connected</hi> in a syllogism, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:25:70" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 25, 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:14:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 14, 56</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 30, 97</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:16:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 16, 37</bibl>; cf. disjunctus.—</sense><sense id="n14276.4" n="B" level="2"> In rhet., a fig. of speech. </sense><sense id="n14276.5" n="1" level="3"> Corresp. to the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">diezeugme/non</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:54:207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 54, 207</bibl> (quoted in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:35" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 1, 35</bibl>); <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n14276.6" n="2" level="3"> Corresp. to the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">sunwnumi/a</foreign>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the use of different words</hi> or <hi rend="ital">phrases having the same import</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:45" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 45</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
disjunctivus: <entryFree id="n14277" type="main" key="disjuncti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">disjunctīvus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">dīj-</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n14277.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">placed in opposition, opposed to each other</hi> (post-class.). </sense><sense id="n14277.1" n="I" level="1"> In philos. lang.: <cit><quote lang="la">proloquium, i. q. disjunctio (II. A.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:11:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 11, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. ib. § 8.—</sense><sense id="n14277.2" n="II" level="1"> In gram. lang., <hi rend="ital">disjunctive, expressed with disjunctive particles</hi> (aut, vel, sive, etc.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 199</bibl> P. et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:35:1:78 al" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 35, 1, 78 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
disjunctus: <entryFree id="n14278" type="main" key="disjunctus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">disjunctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from disjungo.</entryFree>
disjungo: <entryFree id="n14279" type="main" key="disjungo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-jungo</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">dījungo</orth>, <itype>xi, ctum, 3</itype>, <sense id="n14279.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to disjoin, disunite, separate</hi>, opp. to <pb n="591" /> <cb n="DISP" /> conjungo (freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n14279.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n14279.2" n="A" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">to unyoke</hi> draught cattle: <cit><quote lang="la">asinum, bovem ab opere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:6:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 6, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:3:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:251" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 27, 67, § 251</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bovem opere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:15:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 15, 2</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and simply bovem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 36 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 14, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:648 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 648 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n14279.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To wean</hi> sucklings: <cit><quote lang="la">agnos a mamma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:20" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:2:7:12 al" default="NO">2, 7, 12 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n14279.4" n="C" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to divide, separate, part, remove</hi>. </sense><sense id="n14279.5" n="(a)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> only, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 8, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">intervallo locorum et temporum dijuncti sumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod (flumen) Jugurthae Bocchique regnum disjungebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 92:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 92, 5</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n14279.6" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi (fons) munitione ac mole lapidum disjunctus esset a mari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qua in parte Cappadocia ab Armenia disjungitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. Fragm. IV. 20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. Fragm. IV. 20</bibl></cit> ed. Gerl. (ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 535, 17</bibl>); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 59</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14279.7" n="(g)" level="5"> With simple <case>abl.</case>: Italis longe disjungimur oris, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:252" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 252</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n14279.8" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inter se</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:803" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 803</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14279.9" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to separate, part, divide</hi> (esp. freq. in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n14279.10" n="(a)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> only (very rarely): <cit><quote lang="la">sin eos (oratorem et philosophum) disjungent, hoc erunt inferiores, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 35 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 37</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14279.11" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea res disiunxit illum ab illa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:2:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 1, 2, 86</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">eos a colonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:chapter=21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populum a senatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:12:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 12, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pompeium a Caesaris amicitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me ab orationibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 23</bibl></cit> Orell. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos a corporibus (shortly before, sevocare, avocare, and secernere animum a corpore),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pastionem a cultura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:22" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 22</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:1:3" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 1, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">honesta a commodis (opp. commiscere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:7:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 7, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artem a scientia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:15:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 15, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veterem amicitiam sibi ab Romanis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:46:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 46, 6</bibl></cit> et saep.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">disjunctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., separate, distinct; distant, remote</hi>.—With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi> or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n14279.12" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aetolia procul a barbaris disjuncta gentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:37:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 37, 91</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in locis disjunctissimis maximeque diversis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14279.13" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n14279.14" n="1" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">apart, different, remote</hi>. </sense><sense id="n14279.15" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita maxime disjuncta a cupiditate et cum officio conjuncta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:14:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 14, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines Graecos, longe a nostrorum hominum gravitate disjunctos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:67:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 67, 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mores Caelii longissime a tanti sceleris atrocitate disjuncti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:chapter=22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 22</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 1, 3</bibl>; cf. in <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est ab ea cogitatione dijunctius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n14279.16" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque disjuncti doctores, sed iidem erant vivendi praeceptores atque dicendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:15:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 15, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratio, quae similitudines transferat et disjuncta conjungat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:14:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 14, 45</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14279.17" n="2" level="3"> Esp., of discourse, <hi rend="ital">disconnected, abrupt, disjointed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjunctio, quae neque asperos habet concursus, neque disjunctos atque hiantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:6:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. Or. 6, 21</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">of the orator himself: Brutum (oratorem) otiosum atque dijunctum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14279.18" n="3" level="3"> In dialectics, <hi rend="ital">opposed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">disjuncta conjungere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:14:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 14, 45</bibl></cit>: omne, quod ita disjunctum sit, quasi aut etiam, aut non, etc., i. e. <hi rend="ital">logically opposed, disjunctive</hi> (i. q. disjunctio, II. A.), <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 30, 97</bibl>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">disjunc-tum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">that which is logically opposed</hi>: quod Graeci <foreign lang="greek">diezeugme/non a)ci/wma</foreign>, nos disjunctum dicimus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:8:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 8, 12</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi> </sense><sense id="n14279.19" n="a" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">disjunctē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">dij-</orth>), <hi rend="ital">separately, distinctly, disjunctively</hi> (opp. conjuncte), Fest. s. v. SACRAM VIAM, p. 292, 5 Müll.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non satis quae disjunctius dicuntur, intellegis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:13:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 13, 32</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 20, 3, 11</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n14279.20" n="b" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">disjunctim</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">dij-</orth>), opp. conjunctim, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:2:199" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> 2, 199</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:205" default="NO">205</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:7:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 28, 7, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:35:1:49 al" default="NO">35, 1, 49 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
disjurgium: <entryFree id="n14280" type="gloss" key="disjurgi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">disjurgĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>dis-jurgium</etym>, <sense id="n14280.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a difference, quarrel</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3023</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4777</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dismotum: <entryFree id="n14281" type="gloss" key="dismo_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dismōtum</orth>, v. dimoveo <sense id="n14281.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi>‡ † <orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭsōmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">di/swmos</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">holding two bodies</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">VAS,</quote> <trans><tr>a sarcophagus for two persons</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4548</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dispalesco: <entryFree id="n14282" type="hapax" key="dispa_lesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dispālesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n14282.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [dispalor], <hi rend="ital">to spread about, be noised abroad</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 123</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dispalor: <entryFree id="n14283" type="main" key="dispa_lor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-pālor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n14283.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n., to wander about, to straggle, stray</hi> (very rare). </sense><sense id="n14283.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: dispalati ab signis, Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 101, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,006:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Lys. 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hann. 5, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">31, 2</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n14283.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">multitudo in varias artes dispalata,</quote> <trans><tr>scattered, dispersed</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pseudo</author> Sall. de Rep. Ord. 2, 5</bibl></cit>. <cb n="DISP" /></sense></entryFree>
dispando: <entryFree id="n14284" type="main" key="dispando"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-pando</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">dispendo</orth>, no <sense id="n14284.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, sum; also, in colloq. lang., <orth extent="full" lang="la">dispenno</orth>, <itype>dispessus</itype> (in Plaut., <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr>), <hi rend="ital">v. a., to stretch out, spread out, to extend, expand</hi> (very rare). </sense><sense id="n14284.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">dispennite hominem divorsum et distennite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dispessis manibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 7</bibl></cit> (also ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:15:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 15, 4</bibl>); and: <cit><quote lang="la">dispessis membris (Tityos),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:988" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 988</bibl></cit>, v. Lachm. ad h. l. p. 201: <cit><quote lang="la">dispansae vestes in sole,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:306" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 306</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">arbor vastis dispansa ramis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 4, 3, § 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:19" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neu distracta (natura) suum late dispandat hiatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:599" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 599</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n14284.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of speech, <hi rend="ital">to spread out, amplify</hi>, L. Verus ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1248,001:Ep. ad Ver. 3" default="NO"><author>Fronto</author> Ep. ad Ver. 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dispar: <entryFree id="n14285" type="main" key="dispar"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-par</orth>, <itype>ăris</itype>, <sense id="n14285.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., unlike, dissimilar, different, unequal</hi> (freq. and class.; cf.: impar, dissimilis, absimilis). </sense><sense id="n14285.1" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">dispares mores disparia studia sequentur, quorum dissimilitudo dissociat amicitias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:20:74" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 20, 74</bibl></cit>: cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:3:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 3, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ostendi, parem dignitatem, disparem fortunam in Murena atque in Sulpicio fuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:chapter=21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 21</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:chapter=24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 24 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 7, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 52:1 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 52, 1 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:31:87" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 31, 87</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 34</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">proelium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 16, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">certamen,</quote> <trans><tr>unequal, ill-matched</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:2:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 2, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habitus animorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">via dicendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:67" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 67</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">calami,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>unequal, of different lengths</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:711" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 711</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">avenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:192" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 192</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fistula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:682" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 682</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and cicutae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 36</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14285.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">color rebus (opp. par),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:738" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 738</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt his alii multum dispares,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:30:109" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 30, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa oratio huic,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atque discolor matrona meretrici,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 3</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n14285.3" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quicquam dispar sui atque dissimile,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 21, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sortis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:19" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:570" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 570</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
disparasco: <entryFree id="n14286" type="hapax" key="dispa^rasco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dispărasco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>dispar</etym>, <sense id="n14286.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be unlike</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud. Mam.</author> Stat. An. 3, 9 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl> dub.</sense></entryFree>
disparatio: <entryFree id="n14287" type="main" key="dispa^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dispărātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>disparo</etym>, <sense id="n14287.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a separation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">procreationis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a delivery</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">brevis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 21, 12, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dispargo: <entryFree id="n14288" type="main" key="dispargo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dispargo</orth>, v. dispergo.</entryFree>
disparilis: <entryFree id="n14289" type="main" key="dispa^ri^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-părĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <sense id="n14289.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., dissimilar, different</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">pabulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:11:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 11, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">formae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> L. L. 9, § 40</bibl></cit> Müll.: aspiratio terrarum, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:36:79" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 36, 79</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:2:17" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ictus errantium siderum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:216" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 45, 45, § 216</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">dispărĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">differently</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=89" default="NO"><author>id.</author> L. L. 9, § 89</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
disparilitas: <entryFree id="n14290" type="main" key="dispa^ri^li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dispărĭlĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>disparilis</etym>, <sense id="n14290.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dissimilarity, difference</hi> (ante- and post-class. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">vocis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 10:section=36" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 10, § 36</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum, Gell. praef. § 3: collationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:7:3:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 3, 47</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dispariliter: <entryFree id="n14291" type="main" key="dispa^ri^li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dispărĭlĭter</orth>, <sense id="n14291.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adv., differently, dissimilarly</hi>, v. disparilis <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
disparo: <entryFree id="n14292" type="main" key="dispa^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-păro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n14292.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to part, separate, divide</hi> (rare but class.). </sense><sense id="n14292.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">Juppiter nos per gentes alium alia disparat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:prol. 10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. prol. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Servius Tullius) seniores a junioribus divisit, eosque ita disparavit, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 22</bibl></cit>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 28 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab Euphrate brevi spatio disparatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 3, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">14, 8, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14292.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n14292.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">tot sententias in eandem rem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:11:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 11, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab omni turpitudinis labe disparata atque abjuncta divinitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, p. 105</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14292.4" n="B" level="2"> Esp., in rhet.: disparatum est id, quod ab aliqua re per oppositionem negationis separatur, hoc modo: <hi rend="ital">sapere, non sapere</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:28:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 28, 42</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 11, 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dispartibilis: <entryFree id="n14293" type="main" key="disparti^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dispartĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>dispartio</etym>, <sense id="n14293.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">divisible;</hi> coupled with demutabilis (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Hermog. 39</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dispartio: <entryFree id="n14294" type="main" key="dispartio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-partio</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">dispartior</orth>, v. dispertio.</entryFree>
dispatens: <entryFree id="n14295" type="main" key="dispatens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dispatens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> <etym>dis-pateo</etym>, <sense id="n14295.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">opening in different directions</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">latibula sibi parant in plures exitus dispatentia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 10, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dispectio: <entryFree id="n14296" type="main" key="dispecti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dispectĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>dispicio</etym>, <sense id="n14296.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a viewing, considering</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tituli,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res Carn. 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dispecto: <entryFree id="n14297" type="main" key="dispecto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dispecto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n14297.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to consider, contemplate, examine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">momenta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, p. 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dispector: <entryFree id="n14298" type="main" key="dispector"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dispector</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n14298.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who considers, examines, a searcher</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">cordis Deus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alienarum sententiarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ad Uxor. 2, 8</bibl></cit>. <cb n="DISP" /></sense></entryFree>
dispectus: <entryFree id="n14299" type="main" key="dispectus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dispectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from dispicio.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n14300" type="main" key="dispectus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dispectus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>dispicio</etym>, <sense id="n14300.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">regard, consideration, examination</hi>, Sen. de Ira, 2, 9, 2; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 94 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
dispello: <entryFree id="n14301" type="main" key="dispello"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-pello</orth>, <itype>pŭli, pulsum, 3</itype>, <sense id="n14301.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to drive asunder, to scatter, disperse</hi> (rare but class.). </sense><sense id="n14301.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">dispulsa suo de coetu materiaï Copia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:1017" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 1017</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecudes dispulsae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 7, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ater quos aequore turbo Dispulerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:512" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 512</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 538</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">umbras,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 839</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequora prorā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:335" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 335</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14301.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to scatter, drive away, dispel</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(philosophia) ab animo tamquam ab oculis caliginem dispulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:26:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 26, 64</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tenebras calumniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:10:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 10, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">somnos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Troad. 452" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Troad. 452</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:164" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 164</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inediae metum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dispendiosus: <entryFree id="n14302" type="main" key="dispendi^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dispendĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>dispendium</etym>, <sense id="n14302.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hurtful, prejudicial</hi> (post-Aug. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">cunctatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:20:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 20, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occasiones,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Theod.</author> 11, 2, 4 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
dispendium: <entryFree id="n14303" type="main" key="dispendi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dispendĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>dispendo</etym> (opp compendium, v. 3, dis, II.), <sense id="n14303.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">expense, cost, loss</hi> (mostly ante- and post-class.; cf.: impensa, impendium, sumptus; also: noxa, damnum, detrimentum, jactura, incommodum). </sense><sense id="n14303.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">dispendium ideo, quod in dispendendo solet minus fieri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=183" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 183</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">sine damno et dispendio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 1, 35</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">so with sumptus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minore nusquam bene fui dispendio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:3:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 3, 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut gratiam ineat sine suo dispendio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 5, 2, 29</bibl></cit>: neque dispendi facit hilum, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=60" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 60</bibl> Müll.; cf. * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1127</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui afferre dispendium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:24:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 24, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod dispendium pauci intellegunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 6, 9, § 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dispendia (comae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:14:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 14, 43</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:7:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 7, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">viarum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a roundabout way</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:100" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silvae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14303.2" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: hic tibi ne qua morae fuerint dispendia tanti, <hi rend="ital">loss of time</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:453" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 453</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">famae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> VI. Cons. Hon. 452</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">disciplinae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Grat. Act. 32</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dispendo: <entryFree id="n14304" type="main" key="dispendo1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-pendo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n14304.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to weigh out</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">in dispendendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=183" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 183</bibl></cit> Müll.: panis dispensus, i. e. <hi rend="ital">dispensed, distributed</hi>, Prud. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:584" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> 1, 584</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n14305" type="main" key="dispendo2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-pendo</orth>, <sense id="n14305.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to stretch out</hi>, v. dispando.</sense></entryFree>
dispenno: <entryFree id="n14306" type="main" key="dispenno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dispenno</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, v. dispando.</entryFree>
dispensatio: <entryFree id="n14307" type="main" key="dispensa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dispensātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>dispenso</etym>. <sense id="n14307.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Economical management, charge, direction, superintendence</hi>. </sense><sense id="n14307.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aerarii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:15:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Vatin. 15, 36</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14307.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">annonae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">est autem in eximendis favis necessaria dispensatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 14, 14, § 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 78" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 78 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n14307.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The office of a</hi> dispensator, <hi rend="ital">management, administratorship, stewardship</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">dioi/khsis</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 10, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 15, 15, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 834</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,007:9:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Cor. 9, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dispensativus: <entryFree id="n14308" type="main" key="dispensa_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dispensātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n14308.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to management</hi> or <hi rend="ital">administratorship</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">philosophia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 2, 24, 16</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">dispensātīvē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in the manner of an administrator, in substitution</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 112, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dispensator: <entryFree id="n14309" type="main" key="dispensa_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dispensātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n14309.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a household superintendent, a manager, steward;</hi> as manager of the imperial treasury, <hi rend="ital">a cashier, treasurer</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">dioikhth/s</foreign>; <cit><quote lang="la">usually the most trustworthy slaves, but under the emperors sometimes ingenui (v. Orell. on his Inscr. 4002): ab aere pendendo dispensator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=183" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 183</bibl></cit> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 3, 13, § 43</bibl>; and Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=72:9" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 72, 9</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">dispensator litteras scit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:5:3:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 5, 3, 5</bibl></cit> (cf. Krebs, Antibar. p. 371); so id. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 193, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:91" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:67" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:42:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 42, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 39, 40, § 129</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 790</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">895</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2914</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:43:16 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 43, 16 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
dispensatorius: <entryFree id="n14310" type="hapax" key="dispensa_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dispensātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n14310.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">relating to management</hi> or <hi rend="ital">control</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Ies. 14, 53, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dispensatrix: <entryFree id="n14311" type="main" key="dispensa_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dispensātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>dispensator</etym>, <sense id="n14311.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that dispenses, a female steward</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Quaest. Hebr. in Paralip. 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 968, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dispenso: <entryFree id="n14312" type="main" key="dispenso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-penso</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <sense id="n14312.0" n="I" level="1"> Orig. of money, <hi rend="ital">to distribute by weight, to</hi> <pb n="592" /> <cb n="DISP" /> <hi rend="ital">disburse, pay out</hi> (for syn. cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">partior, impertio, distribuo, divido): ducentos nummos (sc. inter milites),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 47</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14312.1" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to manage, regulate</hi> household expenses: <cit><quote lang="la">domesticas res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 11, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:219" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 219</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eligere aliquem ad dispensandam pecuniam,</quote> <trans><tr>to have charge of the military chest</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,009:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Con. 4</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">dispensat pueris vilicus,</quote> <trans><tr>distributes rations</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:18:22" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 18, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14312.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of other things, <hi rend="ital">to dispense, distribute, arrange</hi> (for syn. cf.: dispono, digero, ordino, compono). </sense><sense id="n14312.3" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(fons) certis horarum spatiis dispensatur inter incolas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 22, 51, § 188</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 9" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 13, 27, § 89</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitis aequa portione sucum proli suae dispensat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:24:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 24, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oscula suprema natos per omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:278" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 278</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">dividit oscula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:36:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 36, 6</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">filum candelae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:287" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 287</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem (annum) intercalaribus mensibus interponendis ita dispensavit (Numa), ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n14312.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to manage, regulate, control, distribute</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inventa non solum ordine, sed etiam momento quodam atque judicio dispensare atque componere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:31:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 31, 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi dispensare rem publicam et in ea quodam modo vilicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:5:3:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 5, 3, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:6:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 7, 6, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">laetitiam inter impotentes populi animos,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to impart to them by degrees</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 50 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">male dispensata libertas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 1:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae dispensant mortalia fata sorores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 12, 3</bibl></cit> et saep.: consilium dispensandae cohonestandaeque victoriae imperatoribus majores dederunt nostri (qs. <hi rend="ital">to arrange as the general's manager;</hi> the fig. acc. to I. B., v. also dispensator), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 47</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: si modo recte dispensare velis, <hi rend="ital">to dispense, arrange</hi> ( = administrare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 75</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dispensus: <entryFree id="n14313" type="main" key="dispensus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dispensus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from 1. dispendo.</entryFree>
dispercutio: <entryFree id="n14314" type="hapax" key="dispercu^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-percŭtĭo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n14314.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to dash out</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cerebrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 5, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
disperditio: <entryFree id="n14315" type="main" key="disperdi^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">disperdĭtĭo</orth>, v. dispertitio.</entryFree>
disperdo: <entryFree id="n14316" type="main" key="disperdo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-perdo</orth>, <itype>dĭdi, dĭtum, 3</itype>, <sense id="n14316.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to destroy, spoil, ruin</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">bibe, es, disperde rem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:3:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 3, 32</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 58</bibl>: ut a majoribus nostris possessiones relictas disperdat et dissipet, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 1, 1, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">imaginem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:31:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 31, 4</bibl></cit>. —<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: stridenti miserum stipula disperdere carmen, <hi rend="ital">to spoil</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 27</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of personal objects: lenonem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 96</bibl></cit>: qui tot cives Romanos occidit, arripuit, disperdidit, Vatin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inimicos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:142:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 142, 11</bibl></cit> et saep.— (The <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> forms are not found, dispereo taking their place. In <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:831" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 831</bibl>, dispergitur is the true reading.)</sense></entryFree>
dispereo: <entryFree id="n14317" type="main" key="dispe^re^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-pĕrĕo</orth>, <itype>ii, 4</itype>, <sense id="n14317.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to go completely to ruin, to be lost</hi> or <hi rend="ital">undone, to perish</hi> (rare; <cit><quote lang="la">mostly ante-class.): quin prius disperibit faxo, quam unam calcem civerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fructus dispereunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:11:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 11, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:46:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 46, 2</bibl>: fundus, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:29:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 29, 80</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">disperit cibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:704" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 704</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestis multo sanguine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1422" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 1422</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:376" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 376</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:288 al" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 288 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tui labores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:14:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 14, 11</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Prov.: male partum male disperit,</quote> <trans><tr>light come, light go</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 22</bibl></cit> (for which <hi rend="ital">dilabitur</hi>, Poëta ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 27</bibl>). —</sense><sense id="n14317.1" n="II" level="1"> In colloq. lang.: <cit><quote lang="la">disperii!</quote> <trans><tr>I am undone! it's all over with me!</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 5, 1, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:5:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 5, 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 2, 1, 28</bibl> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 4, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 3, 3, 1</bibl>; Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 110, 13</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which once Dispereo!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: Dispeream, si or nisi, <hi rend="ital">may I perish, if</hi> or <hi rend="ital">if not;</hi> a strong asseveration, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:92:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 92, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:21:9" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 21, 9</bibl> (3, 14, 9 M.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:59 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 59 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
dispergo: <entryFree id="n14318" type="main" key="dispergo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">di-spergo</orth>, in late Lat. and sometimes in MSS. of the older authors written <orth extent="full" lang="la">di-spargo</orth> (cf. aspergo and conspergo), si, sum, 3, <sense id="n14318.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to scatter on all sides, to scatter about, disperse</hi> (freq. and class., esp. in the <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>). </sense><sense id="n14318.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">per agros passim dispergit corpus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Poet. N. D. 3, 26, 67</bibl></cit>; cf. <hi rend="ital">per hypallagen</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">membrorum collectio dispersa (coupled with dissipare),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 9, 22</bibl></cit> (but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:988" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 988</bibl>, the right reading is: <cit><quote lang="la">dispessis membris, not dispersis, v. dispando): cur (deus) tam multa pestifera terra marique disperserit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:Ac. 2:38:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 38, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nubes dispergunt venti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:254" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 254</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">an tibi jam mavis cerebrum dispergam hic?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 2, 7</bibl></cit>; for which: <cb n="DISP" /> ut cerebro dispergat viam, <hi rend="ital">besprinkle</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 2, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caprae dispergunt se, contra oves so congregant et condensant in locum unum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:3:9" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 3, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">comites dispersi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:576" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 576</bibl></cit>; so the <hi rend="ital">mid.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dispersi, of persons,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 13, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:42:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 42, 91</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and esp. freq. of soldiers,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:40:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 40, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 28, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:44:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 44, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 38, 5</bibl> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 98:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 98, 4</bibl>, et saep.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">dispersi a suis pars cedere, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 51:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 51, 1</bibl></cit>; and in the <hi rend="ital">verb. fin. act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (duo milia evocatorum) tota acie disperserat,</quote> <trans><tr>had distributed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:88:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 88, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 23, 53, § 193</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitem traducibus dispergere atque disrarare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:6:36" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 6, 36</bibl></cit>: lactuca dispergitur, <hi rend="ital">set out</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">planted</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">color dispergitur omnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:831" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 831</bibl></cit> (not disperditur, v. Lachm. ad h. l.): <cit><quote lang="la">ubi brachia et crura inaequaliter dispergit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>moves at random</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mesopotamia vicatim dispersa,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>divided</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 26, 30, § 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magna pars Judaeae vicis dispergitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 8</bibl></cit> et saep.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aries dispergit saxa (with effundere muros),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:384" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 384</bibl></cit> Cort.: <cit><quote lang="la">dispersa capillos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo latior (res) est, in cunctas undique partis Plura modo dispargit et ab se corpora mittit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1135</bibl></cit>; so with <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>acc.</case>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:309" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 309</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:34:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 34, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 89, § 220</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tripartitum exercitum plures in manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:74 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 74 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aër dispargitur ad partis minutas corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:895" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 895</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n14318.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">in praesentia tantummodo numeros et modos et partes argumentandi confuse et permixte dispersimus: post descripte ... ex hac copia digeremus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:30:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 30, 49</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:42:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 42, 187</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">191</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:39" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum tam longe lateque dispersum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 12, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in re dispersa atque infinita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0478,001:Pet. Cons. 1" default="NO"><author>Q. Cic.</author> Pet. Cons. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plebis vis soluta atque dispersa in multitudine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 41:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 41, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rumorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">falsos rumores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 96</bibl></cit>; and with <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">volgus fingendi avidum disperserat accitum in adoptionem,</quote> <trans><tr>had given out</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">membratim oportebit partis rei gestae dispergere in causam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:21:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 21, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitam in auras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:617" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 617</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">partem voti in auras,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 795</bibl></cit>.— <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos> in two forms: </sense><sense id="n14318.3" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">dispersē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">dispersedly, here and there</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">disperse et diffuse dictae res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:52:98" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 52, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multis in locis dicta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:52:section=116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 52, § 116</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n14318.4" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">dispersim</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:1:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 1, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:3:2:13" default="NO">3, 2, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:80" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 80</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
